نحن نعمل تطوعياً و لذلك سيتم استخدام كافة التبرعات في تنفيذ المشروع المحدد. هذا المشروع هو باكورة أعمال الاستديو و لذلك نحن نقوم بنشر و تسويق عملنا من خلال تقديمه للناس في عدد من المؤتمرات و بدء مشاورات حول مستقبل المشروع مع منظمات مختلفة. لهذا السبب مساهماتكم لن تساعد في تنفيذ هذا المشروع و حسب بل ستكون حافذاً لمشاريع مستقبلية. سنعمل على تنفيذ المشروع في أغسطس (آب) في حال استطعنا جمع كالم ميزانية المشروع, واذا تعذر جمع كامل ميزانية المشروع فسنسعى لتأمين بقية التمويل و سننفذ المشروع لاحقاً هذا العام
الاسلوب التشاركي المتبع في زياراتنا للموقع مكننا من معرفة ما هو العمل الأمثل لخلق تأثير إيجابي طويل الأمد, و قد أثر ذلك مباشرة على التصميم. ستكون هيكلية باحة اللعب مرنة و قابلة للتجميع, الفك, و اعادة التجميع مما يتوافق مع الطبيعة المؤقتة لأي بنية في المخيمات العشوائية في لبنان. مكونات باحة اللعب قابلة للنقل بسهولة حيث يمكن نقلها الى الداخل السوري بعد نهاية الحرب و استتباب الأوضاع. التصميم مطور ليشمل ملعب كرة قدم/كرة سلة مركزي, حيث يمكن لحصص الرياضة أن تتم. هنالك أيضاً مراجيح, حيطان تسلق, "زحليطة" و نشاطات أخرى, بالإضافة إلى فسحات للراحة و التعليم
شكراً

story:
Summary

 

My name is Aneil Pokharel. I created this fundraiser to tell the story of sorrowful events that just transpired in Nepal with this 7.9 Magnitude earthquake and millions of Nepali's today are affected by this, thousands dead, injured and homeless. The two pictures above are my birth-home, among one of the thousands of homes in Gorkha, Nepal. Close to the epicenter of this earthquake. Utterly destroyed! Completely uninhabitable. I lived here until I was 7 years old. Most of my early childhood memories comes from this house and the surrounding village.  Here, I used to run around and sell grapefruit, a moment a passerby happened to walk by in the gravel road adjacent to the house. This was a house so many of our family members (Uncles, sisters, cousins) called home.  She took care of us well. She stood for 34 years and today she dies. It's certainly very sad!

I am quite glad the roof didn't fall! however. If she was a human then a good CPR would have certainly saved her. I congratulated my dad "Krishna Pokharel" for doing a great job building this house with his own hand. This however is a story millions of Nepali's at home and abroad is telling the world since they are all affected.

Like the Buddha says! All conditioned things are impermanent and attachment to it will cause suffering and a testament to that are being proven in these sorrowful events that just transpired in Nepal, with more than 7000 people dead. 1000's of years old precious buildings have been leveled to ground zero, but we will move on. We will galvanize the world community with social network and help rebuild Nepal in decentralized way with local volunteers and local NGO's on the ground. In the future, we will build better structures that can withstand earthquakes. The villages of Nepal is truly a wonderful place to live in, sort of like the Heaven on Earth( ...that is if you don't have to work the fields and take care of animals). Once the emergency relief work is satisfactory and is under control we intend to rethink and re-engineer new generation houses for our villages in Nepal, leveraging tremendous technical and non-technical resources available via social Networking. Your support  in this aggressive ambition will write the unwritten records in Nepal's history.

Earlier Emergency relief work

We were able to raise some funds 2 days after the earthquake on gofundme site and with the help of Dr Bal Sharma, we connected with local volunteers ( Rudra Pokharel, and Indra Bhattarai) and deployed tents and mosquito nets that supported about 30 families in Chhoprak, Gorkha and hundreds of tents were provided in Simpani, Nepal. Our efforts in initially mobilizing local volunteers who are our uncles, cousins and brothers was a tremendous success. Here are some pictures of that relief work that our local volunteers did in Chhoprak last week. These villages are untouched by government and other relief aid centralized organizations such as the Red-Cross among many others. We are sure the donations will come and eventually help rebuild Nepal but at a time of crisis decentralized more boots on the ground is a much better approach to providing emergency relief to affected individuals.  
In addition to this, we have raised money to buy Corrugated Tin for about 30-40 affected families. This work is being coordinated by Hari Pokharel, Rudra Pokharel and our local NGO in Gorkha called "Goreto".  In our village districts however we have more than 1000 families who are affected who will need our support.  Monsoon season will hit us in about 2 months when non-stop torrential rain will adversely affect many families, so we decided to spend all the money we had raised about $3500 dollars at this time by focusing on a chhoprak VDC WD# 2 and #3. 
   

What do we need?

  • In the short term, we are in constant touch with our contacts in the ground. We need to buy Rice, Lentils, oil, more mosquito nets and more tins for the affected families. We can purchase these things in the local market or India. Normally we can send them money via western union to support their purchases of this material. 
  • We need to stay in close contact with locals on the ground and see how situation develops as the monsoon season is approaching near. These are short term initiatives
  • Mid to longer term, we are looking to champion construction of buildings that can resist seismic anomalies. We are working with an architect in Chile at the moment to come up with a design that we can implement in the villages of Nepal. Next step will be to make a model house. We would like to build a public building such as a hospital or a school that was damaged during the earthquake and thereby champion reconstruction efforts.  
  • If you would like to help with intellectual expertise instead of donating cash then you can also donate your expertise in building structures long term that is compatible with Nepali heritage and landscape. 
In this earlier phase, the funds are being used for emergency relief  as they are being collected. If we raise a fund that is not enough to support our initiative then we will donate this to the NGO in Gorkha called "Goreto".  With your help however we believe we'll make it. 

Donation of cryptocurrency

You could donate us Bitcoins at the above block-chain wallet. We will convert this into cash via coin-base and use it for relief. If there are any parties in Nepal who can receive bitcoins for relief then we will use that route of course. You could also help various organizations in Nepal to receive bitcoin donations, due to it's ease of use. We just need a bank in Nepal who can convert bitcoins to cash. I'd say that is the major hurdle at the moment in Nepal.

The Impact

  • Houses in Nepali villages need to be completely reconstructed. If we can leverage local materials to make earthquake resilient structures then it's carbon footprint is low  
  • There are existing NGO's like one-world design and Nepal engineering society ( ISET nepal) and private organizations like  AATA architect associates in Chile who have experience designing earth quake resilient buildings in seismically unstable areas of Chile. We hope for all of these groups of talent to come together to support reconstruction of Nepali village.   
  • The knowledge we gain here will not only help rebuild Nepal but also in other earthquake prone areas throughout the Himalayas regions and other developing countries that could benefit from learning to build cheap structures.  

Risks & Challenges

  • We are working with local people who are our relatives, so it is easy for us to make them accountable for the activities. 
  • Develop focused approach to providing relief aid in the near term, mid term and the long term so obstacles are easy to manage.
  • Understanding how the NGO and government funds will flow to support our objective within the next 5 year time frame.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you have technical/engineering background you can donate your expertise to us in helping build resilient structures for earthquake, all while maintaining the local architecture, heritage and culture. 
  • For emergency relief aid you can help us coordinate shipment of supplies from areas such as New Delhi, Mumbai, Europe to proper NGO's and inviduals who can distribute the material to help the needy.
  • Contribute your ideas with us towards the best way we can galvanize the world community to help rebuild Nepal.

story:
Your Donation of $1-$5 is INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT!

How could that be, you might ask?

All public charities must demonstrate that they have the support of the public during their first five years of existence. We are approaching that five year mark.

A donation of even $1 will be very, very helpful to us because it will help us demonstrate that we have general public support.

So, please don't hesitate to make a small donation.

And ask your friends to make a donation, as well.

Your doing so will help us keep our public charity status.


Who We Are

Friends of Equal Opportunity in Education Forum, Inc. (FEOEF) is a charitable, educational, and scientific tax exempt nonprofit corporation founded to help meet the general public’s need for access to affordable high quality educational materials.



Our Mission

Provide free online access to the highest quality open source middle school, high school, and early university level mathematics, science, and language arts courses, textbooks, and materials available, for learners around the world.


Our Philosophy

  1. The primary goal of education is the development of responsible, intelligent, compassionate world citizens.

  2. High quality educational resources must be available to everyone, everywhere, anytime.

  3. Comprehensive standards are important and must be supported with high quality textbooks and multimedia-based presentations and exercises.

  4. We all need to not only learn, but learn how to learn, and learn how to teach ourselves anything we deem important to know.

  5. Students learn by hearing, seeing, feeling, thinking, and doing. Instruction needs to be effectively blended.

  6. As high quality university level educational resources are made more readily available, the gaps between those who can benefit from such resources and those who cannot will grow, and could become intractable if left effectively unaddressed.

  7. The general public needs a smoother pathway from primary and secondary school level education all the way up to high quality university level education.


What We Do

We are primarily engaged in three activities:

  1. Developing open educational resources for pre-university and early university level learners.

  2. Publishing high quality open educational courses and materials online for free.

  3. Curriculum research and development aimed at finding ways to help people not only learn, but learn how to learn.


The Free Learning Channel

FEOEF offers a free open educational portal, The Free Learning Channel, which provides well-recognized academic standards, courses, textbooks, and news targeted to middle school, secondary school, and early university level learners, around the world.


While there are many websites that offer courses to the general public, and some do it for free, our approach is unique, as we are one of the first, if not the first, to:

  1. Provide free access to courses from multiple leading universities and educational institutions.

  2. Embrace an international standards-based approach.

  3. Provide course content broken down into its primary pedagogical elements.

  4. Offer a truly dynamically-responsive-to-browser-size user experience.

We are pioneers. We conceive and develop open educational resources that are not only loosely coupled and highly cohesive, but we dare to care about how well the content itself helps prepare students, both enrolled students and self-learners, for real life.

We are top-down and comprehensive. Unlike some sites that provide an extensive and growing library of well-known topics that are now being organized into courses and curricula, we have built our courses and materials with well-established standards and curricula in mind right at the outset. We don't retrofit topics to standards - we start with well-established standards and build out from there.

Moreover, we are not limited to merely taking standards and curricula as givens. We also evaluate, research, and develop alternatives whenever we think the need arises. We endeavor to offer BOTH traditional curricula as well as alternative standards and curricula.


You can view FEOEF's YouTube Channel via the following link:



You can view slideshows of The Free Learning Channel via the following links:

The Free Learning Channel - General Slideshow


The Free Learning Channel - Academic Standards Slideshow


The Free Learning Channel - Courses Slideshow


Corporate Supporters

As a charitable, educational, and scientific non-profit tax exempt foundation, Friends of Equal Opportunity in Education Forum, Inc. appreciates the recognition and generous donations it receives from several major corporate supporters.

We are pleased to have generous support from TechSoup, Microsoft Corporation, and Adobe Corporation.

We depend on their excellent products and services to establish our corporate technology infrastructure, operational systems, and project management capabilities, as well as to create, publish, and market our educational content and materials.

       


Current Resources

Friends of Equal Opportunity in Education Forum, Inc. has been fortunate to have established a number of supportive relationships and acquired various resources, since its incorporation in 2010.

We have at our disposal five reasonably powerful desktop computers, and over half a dozen laptop computers.

We have licenses or subscriptions to the best software technology we feel that we need at this point.

We have unlimited non-profit channel accounts on YouTube, where we can post unlimited videos of unlimited length.

We have accounts with web hosting service providers that host our corporate website as well as our free learning channel website.

We are incorporated in Delaware, and have IRS 501(c)(3) tax exempt public charity status as a charitable, educational, and scientific organization.

We provide access to open educational courses and materials from multiple leading universities and educational institutions, including MIT, Harvard, UC Berkeley, Yale, Khan Academy, and others.

We are a well-established organization with hardware, software, infrastructure, tools, procedures, and a small dedicated volunteer staff in place and functioning well.


Our Management Team

Our executive management team is comprised of seasoned professionals from the fields of institutional investment management, institutional technology management, software development and publishing, project management, and education.

We have all worked together on major projects, and have known each other for decades. In other words, we work very well together.

We also share a passion for education and for helping others.

The Executive Management Team
Derrick Lewis - Board Chairman and CEO
Derrick has extensive experience and a proven track record in each of the above mentioned areas of competence. He has considerable international experience, having lived, worked, and studied abroad for decades. His international experience is a key reason FEOEF has an international standards-based perspective.

Derrick founded, developed, and has managed FEOEF since 2003, prior to its subsequent incorporation in 2010. He served as Founder and Managing Director of a finance and technology consulting firm, where he worked with significant financial institutions for decades. Derrick has also worked with the boards of several major homeless shelters in New York City.

Herbert Tam - Board Member
Herbert has extensive experience and a proven track record in each of the above mentioned areas of competence. He has considerable international experience, having lived, worked, and studied abroad for decades. Herbert has a bachelors and a masters degree in computer science and has worked with such companies as AT&T Bell Labs, Credit Suisse, and Societe Generale, in the US, as well as having founded a foreign language school in China.

Marc Callender - Board Member
Marc has extensive experience and a proven track record in each of the above mentioned areas of competence. Marc has a bachelors degree in music. He has worked with such companies as Credit Suisse, iSalvage, Integrated Financial Systems, and a host of others. For the past eight years, Marc has been a senior technologist at Morgan Stanley in New York.


All Forms of Support Are Appreciated

In these difficult times, we all have to do more, better, quicker, with less.

A financial contribution would be very helpful.

If you cannot make a financial contribution at the time, then your help getting the word out about us would be a contribution and be appreciated.


Thank you for your consideration, and please do support us.

story:
THE LIGHT ACADEMY

WHO WE ARE

The Light Academy is a private co-educational institution located in Adenta, a suburb of Accra, Ghana (West Africa) A couple who have been blessed by God and want to affect lives opened the school. The Light Academy has been in existence for the past 16 years.

WHAT WE DO

We are conventionally seen as a basic school providing quality and affordable Basic Education serving the middle and working class people.

Additionally, we are aimed at keeping the children in our care at a safe place so that their parents can pursue their career and be well able to provide for them. Co-parenting is what is driving us to offer this service.

Highly trained and motivated teachers have been employed to ensure excellent results are attained from three (3) months when they are enrolled in the school till age fourteen (14) at the end of their stay in the school. Again, we are opened to affect lives and change society for the better.

B.E.C.E RESULTS / SPECIAL AWARDS

  • The school has turned out 10 batches so far.
  • 100% passes in all the batches.
  • Ranked 27th out of 10,000 schools in the country (the 2006 Basic School’s Excellence Awards).
  • Ranked 17th out of 10,000 schools in the country ( the 2007 Basic School’s Excellence Awards)
  • Among the 40 best schools in the country.
  • Member of Platinum League of schools.
  • Member of UNESCO – ASPNET schools
  • The (1st) in Adenta Municipality over the years.

OUR VISION

is to become a Number One (No.1) Basic and Senior Secondary Institution in Ghana with emphasis on Science Education and giving the girl child the opportunity to also excel in the Science and I.C.T age.

Since we are geared at affecting lives, we place emphasis on delivering academic performance but we also put in place programs like music, art, drama, sports and technical education.

OUR NEED

We need a pavilion to enhance the teaching of technical subjects like carpentry, bead – making, basket weaving, calabash artistry, painting and technical drawing.

Currently the area designed for our technical and vocational education looks like this:


When completed this is the final 3D outlook:

Side view


Front view


OUR PLEA

Help us raise an amount of $35,000.00 which is the total cost for the construction of the Pavilion. We have various forms of rewards for donors. From customized souvenirs, caps, mugs, key-holders, to having the Pavilion named after the highest donor. Help us, Help our Kids.


MESSAGE FROM THE HEADMASTER (MR. OHENE ABOAGYE)

The pavillion will be used for various practical lessons most especially  in B.D.T

B.D.T is a subject in the Junior High School Curriculum. The full name is Basic Design And Technology. The subject is made up of the following aspects;

1. Pre-Technical Skills: Which includes;

  •       Woodwork
  •       Metalwork
  •       Blockwork

2. Home Economics: Which also involves

  •      Life Skills and
  •      Food and Nutrition (cooking)

3. Visual Arts: Which deals more with art works.

All of these aspects involve practical lessons. We are however not able to do these due to the fact that they all have to be done in the open at the mercy of the weather-sometimes rainy, sunny and windy.

As a result of this, teachers resort to more theoretical work at the expense of practicals.

We strongly believe that a pavilion will go a long way to enhance the teaching and learning of the subject. There would be effective practical lessons which will go a long way to develop and arouse the interest of students who might want to pursue it further.

story:
What We're Up To:

The Arizona State University Dust Devils Microgravity Team proposes to utilize the Reduced Gravity Education Flight Program to observe the coagulation of dust particles in microgravity environments.

We'll spare you the tech jargon and buzzwords (for now*), but can say that this is a VERY cool opportunity for our team and an incredibly exciting experiment! In short, we are flying an experiment that will attempt to answer questions about how our planet, solar system, and galaxies formed BILLIONS of years ago!

Our team consists of highly motivated undergraduate engineering, science and business majors that have worked tirelessly to develop an experiment that would be accepted to the NASA Reduced Gravity Educational Flight Program. The team succeeded in this goal through superb interdisciplinary cooperation with only a 16% acceptance rate (the lowest ever) AND the shortest turnaround time for the experiment to be flown!

What We Need From You:


Here is where you come in, we now need to be able to pay for the experiment, travel, and other expenses that accompany such a wonderful opportunity as this! We have already built the majority of the experiment and raised as much as possible, but we still need YOUR help to get us to NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston, as well as finish off some more intricate details of the experiment.

Thank you very much for your enthusiasm and support in funding this campaign, and we hope you enjoy the perks we have provided!

*see below the team description for all of the wonderful, glorious, science and engineering speak.


Highly Technical Science and Build Breakdown:

The experiment will focus on determining the mechanisms responsible for triboelectric charging of particles by varying size and composition of the dust particles studied. The microgravity environment will enable the observation of these weaker dipole interactions between particles. Better understanding of this coagulation mechanism will provide insight into the formation of planets from proto-planetary disks as well as the charging effects of particles on planetary surfaces.

Experiment Structural Design

The 11 chambers with partial vacuum are cylindrical made out of machined Aluminum-6061 alloy with a pressure-rated, heat-resistant Borosilicate glass to serve as the end-caps and viewing windows. O-rings will be used to seal and maintain the chambers at the low pressure values. The ten chambers will be mounted and secured within an aluminum frame in two rows of five with the additional chamber, containing the meteorite sample attached at one end. The containment frame is constructed from 1/8” thick and 1” wide angled aluminum and will be mounted in a larger outer frame to secure the chambers as well as vacuum tubes, lights and cameras, and external activators, such as the vibration tools to move the dust particles. The entire structure will be entirely contained and bolted down to a polycarbonate flight box. The edges of the flight box are padded in order to prevent possible injury during flight. It will be secured to the aircraft floor with 6 cargo straps. The computer controls will be housed in a case outside of the polycarbonate protection case for ease of access but still strapped to it for safety. The approximate size for this experiment is 15” x 36” x 15”.

story:
Digitizing Deaf Education

In mid 2012, NMS Cares was launched with a goal to empower the youth of the local community by helping them realize their self-worth through holistic education. 

Two years later, we have re-focused our vision and mission by committing to advocate for less privileged Deaf kids. 

For the past year, we have renovated and improved the facilities of the Hearing Impaired Sequence at the Special Education Center here in Baguio City, Philippines. 

We realize the positive impact technology has for Deaf students. We are currently pushing to fully digitize the learning experience of the Deaf kids in our community. We started by installing second-hand computer units at SPED Center Baguio Hearing Impaired Sequence and would like to further upgrade their educational facilities to make teaching and learning more effective and efficient. 


So Far, We Have Accomplished the Following:

  • Renovated 3 classrooms at the Hearing Impaired Sequence of the SPED Center - fixed roof and floor, installation of new learning materials as well as the setting up of wide wall mirrors and customized furniture designed specifically for hearing impaired learners.

  • Set-up 8 second hand computer units for the use of the teachers and the students.
  • Set up an Internet connection for the Hearing Impaired Sequence.

  • Employed a dedicated IT teacher for the Deaf learners.


What We Need

Our short term goal is to be able to have a one tablet per pupil ratio for our pilot subject grade level pupils (Ages 3 to 7 years old) from SPED Center Baguio.

Currently, we are targeting to produce 15 tablets.

Our long term goal is to be able to provide one tablet for all the chosen Deaf beneficiaries of the organization from different SPED Centers catering to the Deaf across the region.

Tablets will be installed with the appropriate educational apps geared for Deaf learners to give them the freedom to explore and discover a fun and interactive way of learning!

Every dollar earned will go immediately to the purchase of tablets and if we exceed our goal, we'll use the excess funds to purchase more computer units and start building our dream IT Room for the kids!


The Impact

With the help of technology, we are giving Deaf kids, especially those who are in the less privileged sector of the society, an opportunity to having a more enhanced learning experience.

With better opportunities,  Deafness is never a barrier. 

Help us digitize Deaf Education in our community. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in our cause but can't donate,  you can help immensely by spreading the word online via Facebook, twitter and all over social media. 

Together we can help Deaf children reach their dreams!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

JUST A QUICK LITTLE UPDATE (as of July 9)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Using tablets that we already have in hand previously donated by the Eyking Family (the family of our organization's founder) so that we can test the effectivity of teaching using this technology to Deaf learners, NMSC staff spent an afternoon with a couple of kids from the Hearing Impaired Sequence of SPED Baguio. 


The impromptu Math class held at the school's gym was headed by Ian, the organization's IT teacher. He is one of the 3 profoundly Deaf professionals employed by the organization who also serves as an inspiration to young Deaf learners, showing them that Deafness is never a barrier to reaching their dreams!

story:
- Don't forget to click a perk on the right hand side of this campaign before contributing! - 

Where Does All this Money Go?:

In short - we are raising money to help and support Israeli kids with dyslexia and other language based learning difficulties who are currently not adequately receiving the needed support in the regular or special education system.
How?
1) Kol Koreh Consultant - Sending our staff members to schools to educate and provide guidance and support to teachers and children,
2) Kol Koreh Professional Staff - help identity and provide research based intervention to support specific needs of these students
3) Kol Koreh Resource Center - Purchasing equipment and technology, renting classroom in a local community center (no building required for this organizational model!),  bringing in staff for extra curricular activities

Additionally, we want this program to expand so that we can help other cities set this system in place.

Our Mission:

Children with Language Based Learning Difficulties Have A Lot of Potential. 

Kol Koreh is paving the way for Israeli kids, parents, and teachers to  approach dyslexia and other language based learning difficulties so they can succeed.

Already on they way to success in one city - our model was created in order that other cities both in Israel, and even around the world, can implement a turn-key solution that can answer the needs of children struggling with dyslexia and language based learning difficulties in their city.  


What You Get in Return?

A good conscience is worth all the prizes in the world - you will know you have helped children actually realize their potential.  In addition to this, we are offering interesting perks that are both useful and allow you to show your support for our cause and further spread our message.


Other Ways You Can Help?

In addition to commiting to one (or more than one) of our perks, we also need help spreading this message.  Sending this Indiegogo campaign to 5 of your friends or colleagues will also help this mission succeed.  Your help and support is much appreciated.

story:
Hey, what's the deal with Rock Camp? 

Good question! Rock Camp is a supportive place where diverse groups of kids come together to be empowered by creative collaboration through rock 'n roll.

 Our Rock Camps are programs of YEAH!, a 501(c)3 non-profit that has been facilitating music and arts programming for twelve years. Southern Girls Rock 'n Roll Camp, Tennessee Teens Rock Camp (Nashville & Murfreesboro), New York City Rock Camp, and Rock Block (Nashville & Murfreesboro) are all projects of YEAH!. These programs culminate in a showcase where the campers perform the songs they have written in venues like Mercy Lounge in Nashville or The Knitting Factory in Brooklyn! 

  • We've reached over 3,500 kids and helped them realize that they can do anything they put their minds (and drum sticks!) to. At least 50% of our campers come on full or partial scholarship, and we have NEVER turned a kid away due to lack of funds. Every camper who has ever wanted to attend camp has come, regardless of what they can afford to contribute. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are reaching out to YOU and asking you to help us raise $5,000 in order to sustain, expand, and market our programming to more and more kids all across Middle Tennessee. We are committed to our Scholarship Program and we need you to help us make it work! We also need to fix and buy equipment for kids to rock on, help bring high-profile speakers and guest bands to open up their world, keep the lights in our office on, provide food and coffee for our amazing volunteers, and so much more!
  • If you choose to donate, help spread the word on social media by using the hashtag #whyihelpedrockcamp with the reason you donated for a chance to win a Full Camp Scholarship for your camper or another rockin' kid this summer! 
  • If you donate $100 or more, you will get a special vintage deadstock Rock Camp tee!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't give monetarily, don't fret! There are tons of ways to get involved. 

    • Get the word out! Share this with any and every person online, make some noise about it at the coffee shop or community center, & tell your cat so s/he can spread the word! We rely on word-of-mouth to make our programs happen.
    • Share this link with your community and tag us on Instagram @youth_empowerment, Twitter at @yeah_inthe_boro, and on our Facebook.
    • Email our Director Sarah Bandy at artsempoweryouth@gmail.com for more information or to volunteer for an event!
    • Sign up for our newsletter to stay in the know!

    Mission

    Youth Empowerment through Arts & Humanities, Inc. (YEAH!) builds a creative connected community by providing experiences in the arts for young people ages 10-17. YEAH! believes that artistic education, collaboration, expression, and performance empower youth to become creative, productive and confident members of our community.

story:
Here's the deal.

Imagine you're working in a place with extremely high rates of sexual violence and it's your job to help prevent that violence. You set up a school program for girls that empowers them to know what to do when they encounter anything from harassment to life threatening attacks. Now, imagine that the teachers say that unless you bring in programing for boys, you will lose access to the girls. Not only that, they give you a deadline. 

My name is Lee Paiva and that was the reality of our organization in 2011. We were working in the slums of Nairobi, doing effective work with women and girls. Research showed that the incidence of rape in the schools where we taught was cut in half!  

                                           

Why did we now have to double our staff, salaries, and trainings to include boys? 

Light Bulb Moment

                                          

I heard a voice, or some kind of knowing that said, “You will have the attention of over 30,000 boys in 2012 and 2013 - what would you want to say to them?” 

BINGO

The vast majority of perpetrators are men and boys. We need to go from the empowerment of girls to prevent sexual assault to the empowerment of boys in preventing sexual assault. What happens when we work on this problem from both sides? 

That's the journey I'm asking you to join now. 

We hired Edgework Consulting to help develop cutting edge curricula for boys, piloted them in high schools and then middle schools to study the effects.  The research was stunning. At a 10 month follow-up, the positive gender knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors were still going strong and they were using their new skills. Boys overwhelmingly want to be involved, are ready to intervene in violence and take on other roles crucial to gender equity. They just need the training to do it safely and effectively. 

                                           

               This is where you come in.

At this time, we are the only dual gender sexual assault prevention program in the world. We are partnering with funders to bring classes to 100,000 boys in 2015. We have over 150 male and female trainers, but to achieve a GBV-free world, we need more. 

So what’s the hold up? We need a scalable teacher training course for men.  

Again we turn to Edgework Consulting to build a 4 Week Intensive Training equal to power to the women's training. It will focus on foundational knowledge of the roots of violence and our prevention philosophy and skills. Building a 4 Week Intensive Training for male trainers around the world is an awesome task. It takes time, research, and money. 

          

Why You?

Your funding for this new training course will mean no restrictions on the content, so we can base the curriculum on real world pressures and experiences instead of directives from large-scale funders. 

Don’t think small!  If you contribute to this fundraising campaign you will become part of the largest dual gender, skills-based assault prevention campaign in history. This training will be used with boys and young men from every sector of society around the world. Research will be conducted on its efficacy by our research team members at Stanford, Johns Hopkins, Harvard, and United States International University. 

Let’s provide boys and young men with the tools they need to help make a peaceful world for themselves, their families and their communities. 

Where's the money going?

The Male 4-Week Intensive Training (4WIT) is being developed in 3 phases. 

Phase 1 - Creation of the Training Outline: We will develop a day-by-day calendar of what will be taught in the 4 week intensive. 

Phase 2 - Written Content: We will fill in the training outline with dialogue, skills and activities, create teaching materials and complete the written curriculum of classes. 

Phase 3 - Implementation: We will run the training in Kenya where Edgework and our students form the first Master Trainer group for male trainers. 

Once the curriculum for the Men's 4WIT is complete, we will pilot it for one year before it's deployed globally. In that time, the training hubs that are currently in development in Malawi, Nairobi and the USA will be ready to move forward with our dual gender programing.  Plans are also underway for these dual gender trainings to take place in India, South Africa, and the DRC.

Insanely Powerful

If you believe in an equitable world free of GBV, help us build it. Raise entire generations of kids ready and willing to create peaceful lives and communities. Be part of this insanely powerful movement to end violence against women and children - by empowering the girls and boys themselves! 

Visit our website for more information and inspiration:                                                  www.nomeansnoworldwide.org  

                                          

Who is Edgework Consulting?

We’re glad you asked! Edgework Consulting, an organizational and leadership development company, has been an integral partner of No Means No Worldwide since 2008.we're At its core, Edgework’s approach is rooted in research and informed by human behavioral intelligence. Edgework designed our boys’ curriculum and did so in their hallmark trifecta fashion of being research based, dynamically driven and long-term outcomes focused. We have seen over and over again the extraordinary power of what they can do to transform the lives of our students. The efficacy of their classes is truly outstanding. I encourage you to learn more about them.

           Published Research 

  • http://pediatrics.aappublications.org/content/early/2014/04/09/peds.2013-3414.abstract
  •  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=self+defense+training+in+nairobi

  • http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(14)61703-7/fulltext
Media Coverage

story_txt:
Here's the deal.Imagine you're working in a place with extremely high rates
of sexual violence and it's your job to help prevent that violence. You set up a
school program for girls that empowers them to know what to do when they
encounter anything from harassment to life threatening attacks. Now, imagine that the teachers say that unless you bring in programing for
boys, you will lose access to the girls. Not only that, they give you a deadline. 
My name is Lee Paiva and that was the reality of our organization in 2011. We were working in the slums of Nairobi, doing effective work with women and
girls. Research showed that the incidence of rape in the schools where we taught was cut in half!                                              
Why did we now have to double our staff, salaries, and trainings to include boys? Light Bulb Moment                                           I heard a voice, or some kind of knowing that said, “You will have the attention of over 30,000 boys in 2012 and 2013 - what would you want to say
to them?” BINGOThe vast majority of perpetrators are men and boys. We need to go from the empowerment of girls to prevent sexual assault to the empowerment of boys in preventing sexual assault. What happens when we work on this problem from both sides? That's the journey I'm asking you to join now. We hired Edgework Consulting to help develop cutting edge curricula for boys, piloted them in high schools and then middle schools to study the effects.  The research was stunning. At a 10 month follow-up, the positive gender knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors were still going strong and they were using their new skills. Boys overwhelmingly want to be involved, are ready to intervene in violence and take on other
roles crucial to gender equity. They
just need the training to do it safely and effectively.                                                            This is where you come in.At this time, we are the only dual gender sexual assault prevention program in the world. We are partnering with
funders to bring classes to 100,000 boys in 2015. We have over 150 male and female trainers, but to achieve a GBV-free world, we need more. So what’s the hold up? We need a scalable teacher training course for men.  Again we turn to Edgework Consulting to build a 4 Week Intensive Training equal to power to the women's training. It will focus on foundational knowledge of the roots of violence and our prevention philosophy and skills. Building a 4 Week Intensive Training for male trainers around the world is an awesome task. It takes time, research, and money. 
          
Why You?Your funding for this new
training course will mean no restrictions on the content, so we can base the curriculum on real world pressures and experiences instead of directives from large-scale funders. 
Don’t think small!  If you contribute to this
fundraising campaign you will become part of the largest dual gender, skills-based
assault prevention campaign in history. This
training will be used with boys and young men from every sector of society
around the world. Research will be
conducted on its efficacy by our research team members at Stanford, Johns
Hopkins, Harvard, and United States International University. Let’s
provide boys and young men with the tools they need to help make a peaceful
world for themselves, their families and their communities. Where's the money going?The Male 4-Week Intensive Training (4WIT) is being developed in 3 phases. Phase 1 - Creation of the Training Outline: We will develop a day-by-day calendar of what will be taught in the 4 week intensive. Phase 2 - Written Content: We will fill in the training outline with dialogue, skills and activities, create teaching materials and complete the written curriculum of classes. Phase 3 - Implementation: We will run the training in Kenya where Edgework and our students form the first Master Trainer group for male trainers. Once the curriculum for the Men's 4WIT is complete, we will pilot it for one year before it's deployed globally. In that time, the training hubs that are currently in development in Malawi, Nairobi and the USA will be ready to move forward with our dual gender programing.  Plans are also underway for these dual gender trainings to take place in India, South Africa, and the DRC.Insanely PowerfulIf you believe in an equitable world free of GBV, help us build it. Raise entire generations of kids ready and willing to create peaceful lives and communities. Be part of this insanely powerful movement to end violence against women and children - by empowering the girls and boys themselves! Visit our website for more information and inspiration:                                                  www.nomeansnoworldwide.org                                             Who is Edgework Consulting?
We’re
glad you asked! Edgework Consulting,
an organizational and leadership development company, has been an integral
partner of No Means No Worldwide since 2008.we're At its core, Edgework’s
approach is rooted in research and informed by human behavioral intelligence.
Edgework designed our boys’ curriculum and did so in their hallmark
trifecta fashion of being research based, dynamically driven and long-term
outcomes focused. We have seen over and over again the extraordinary power of
what they can do to transform the lives of our students. The efficacy of their
classes is truly outstanding. I encourage you to learn more about them.


           Published Research

story:
Update 7/2/14... Montclair High School Varsity Eight (pictured above) beat Winchester College today to advance to Day 2 of the Henley Royal Regatta 2014. Thanks for supporting Montclair High School's athletes!

GO MONTCLAIR!

Hi, we are the Montclair High School Rowing Team Boys Varsity Eight. The nine of us have had a successful rowing career proudly representing Montclair High School for four years. 

In 2013, in Boys Junior Varsity Eights, we were proud to achieve the following results:

  • 1st place in 3rd, 4th and 5th Manny Flick series of races in Philadelphia.
  • 1st place at State Championships, Philadelphia City Championships and Stotesbury Cup Regatta
  • 2nd place at SRAA National Championships

In 2014, in Boys Varsity Eights, we became the first Northern New Jersey Varsity Eight to qualify for the Stotesbury Cup Final in this event, where we won a Bronze medal. Our other achievements this spring were winning Silver at State Championships and coming in 5th in the Grand Final at SRAA Nationals, the only public school in the final.

We’ve worked hard, we’ve worked together, and we've each given it our all to be the very best we can be.  To cap off our HS career we are headed to England to row at Henley Royal Regatta and we need your help.

Henley Royal Regatta is the most famous regatta in the world and we are extremely excited and proud to be racing there. For each of us, it is a dream come true to race at this prestigious regatta and represent Montclair High School, New Jersey and the US.

Our Goal: $5,000

We are thankful to our parents for covering most of our expenses, but we wanted to kick in as much as possible to help defray some of the cost.  Renting the boat, paying for travel, food and lodging could cost about $3,000 - 3,500 for each of us. It really adds up.  Besides this cool crowd-sourcing site we are also raising money by holding a garage sale, bake sale, and car wash.

We are asking YOU to help us reach our fundraising goal of $5,000 to help lighten the load a bit and to take some of the financial burden off our folks.

In recognition of your contribution, we'll be sending you some pretty awesome thank you gifts.  These goodies are described in the column to the right.

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help. Talk this up (in person and on-line) and ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. We need all the help that we can get.

Thank You

As we progress towards achieving our goal we will keep you posted on this site and through Facebook as well.  We are forever grateful for this opportunity. 

The Montclair Senior 8: Izzy Corriere, Janek Bielski, Matias Hahn, Abe Kolko, Joe Michalitsianos, Eli Pimpao, Nathan Pollack, Jonny Silverman, and James Wisniewski

story:
Short Summary

My name is Carolyn Fisher. My dear friend Adriana is the Principal of a small school in Tecate called Integral Education School. Adriana is the warmest most caring person I know.  Last year, the kids in her school helped me build a roof for a woman in desperate need of a roof and running water! The kids were amazing! Well, now Adriana's school is growing and we need a roof and another classroom for HER school.

With a degree education Adriana teaches English and French.  "Our school is the only totally English immersed school in all of Tecate.  We have every opportunity to be aware of the learning process of each one individually. We are a very small school and the children learn at their own pace. It is very individualized program so we teach them one on one."

  • The school desperately needs you your help! Our campaign is to provide some basic things like a roof, another classroom and supplies. Your donation provides shelter from the rain and a safe place in which the students can learn. Your contribution will make a deep and lasting impact in the parents as well,  because they will know that we are investing wisely and into their children and ultimately attract more students to the school .

What We Need & What You Get

We need building supplies for paint, wood, stucco, and other building materials.Your dollars go a long way here all of the money will be stretched to the most. If you wish, we will acknowledge you to the class and the students will personally write a thank you letter ! You will have a important part in the children's lives because they will know that somebody cares for their school, thus their education. We have plenty of labor and workers. We just need the materials and that costs money.

The Impact

  • Educated people means a better world. People with values impact the community and the society at large in powerful ways. Our most recent campaign involved a little girl and her Grandmother. As a school we rallied together and built a roof for them, painted the interior of their house and the family enjoyed a dry warm place for the winter. The entire school got involved. Every student felt they had changed the life of a family forever. They are now encouraged to keep on helping. In fact, recently a group of the students asked "Can we go back? We want to help another house!"

Risks & Challenges

There is no other basic need than food and shelter. You are helping with this need. The child is our future.   Without these things our enrollment suffers and we cannot be as effective. We are a group dedicated teachers whose sole purpose in life is to improve the life and education of every child that enters our doors. The pictures of our past projects is a testimony to our commitment and vision.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you cannot donate at this time, we do appreciate your prayers and your willingness to share this information with those you know who may desire to help in this way.  Please use the Indiegogo share page to get the word out for us!

story:
For the past year as the Work Experience (WE) Coordinator  at Penny Lane Centers, I have had the privilege to assist 22 participants in gaining valuable work experience that they would have otherwise never had an opportunity to explore. 

We have tailored the WE program for those youth who really need a hand in learning about themselves, who they are and what they want to do for the foreseeable future. A lot of our participants struggle with school, social support from family and/or their foster home setting. By contrast, our participants have had support from the beginning to the end of their WE experience.

 The beauty of this program is that we've really allowed our participants to find out on their own terms what working is about. If there is anything that I have learned from our participants it is that sometimes they simply are not ready for a job but they get to learn this based on their own experience.

Thank you for seeing the possibilities in these youth!

Jennie Monroy

Short Summary

Penny Lane Centers has been serving disadvantaged children, youth and families in Los Angeles County for over 45 years.  Our mission is to foster hopes and empower children, youth and families to reach their highest potential.

What We Need & What You Get

With your support, we will provide 10 youth with a six-week paid internship at $9.00 an hour for 12 hours per week.

We have existing partnerships with several local businesses and our interns have been placed at Home Goods, Marshall’s, Auntie Anne’s Pretzels, Petco, Robeks, Ralph’s, Vallarta’s and Tommy’s. 

Your contribution will not only help us offer our youth paid internships, you will also help us with the cost of required uniforms and shoes, as well as bus passes.

The Impact

To our youngsters, an internship is not as scary or intimidating as an actual job because they view it as training and not as a job they can be fired from if they make a mistake.  They are allowed to learn, develop skills, interact with their community and experience success for the first time.  An internship can help them build up their self-esteem, develop coping skills that promote personal and professional growth and learn practical skills that will help them gain stable employment.

Challenges

We would love to see 100% of our youth getting a permanent job; however this is not a realistic outcome with the issues these youth struggle with, including mental health illnesses and traumatic childhood experiences such as abuse, neglect and domestic violence.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us open doors for our youth by partnering with us.  We can place a youth at your job site and with your help and guidance, they can gain valuable hands on experience.

story:
Royal Robots of Annapolis Royal Nova Scotia have repeated at Provincial First Lego League Robotics Champions for the second year in a row, and have qualified to represent Nova Scotia in St. Louis (MO) at the World Festival 22 -25 April 2015 http://www.usfirst.org/roboticsprograms/first-championship.

The mission of First Lego League is to inspire young people to be science and technology leaders, by engaging them in exciting mentor-based programs that build science, engineering and technology skills, that inspire innovation, and that foster well-rounded life capabilities including self-confidence, communication, and leadership. First Lego League attracts over 20,000 teams in over 70 countries each year.

The teamsprogram an autonomous robot (using the LEGO® MINDSTORMS® robot set) to score points on a thematic playing surface, and create an innovative solution to a problem as part of their project, all while being guided by the FLL Core Values (www.firstlegoleague.org ). Like any other organized “sport”, teams also fundraise, create a team identity, and go on field trips.

For their project this year the team has started a YouTube Channel (RR History News), to help middle-schoolers to learn Social Studies (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoRvHQsPEQR8QUJ9oUTWjqA). A survey of their school showed that Social Studies was the subject that most of the students found difficult to understand, so the team decided to help with this by making instructional videos and posting these on their channel. They are encouraging teachers to assign the production of these simple videos to their classes as a way to better engage students in the topic.

Please donate to help Royal Robots travel to St. Louis to compete with 107 other high performing teams from around the globe under the Edward Jones Dome (home of the NFL Rams).

story:
Our appeal is back up again, thank you for your patience!

Hello!

This is an extraordinary time in Scotland.

We go to the polls in May to elect the Westminster parliament and Scottish voters have a decision to make.

We have real power in our hands.

Westminster still controls Scotland’s foreign and defence policies, and Scotland’s budget. It will decide whether or not we spend £100 billion replacing Trident.

Westminster will decide whether we have sufficient funds for our education system and NHS.

So Westminster matters.

The polls show that in East Dunbartonshire the SNP are favourites to win. Voters – whether they were Yes or No supporters in the Referendum – trust the SNP to fight Scotland’s corner at Westminster if, as looks likely, there’s another hung parliament.

Between now and May I want to run a high profile, optimistic campaign carrying forward from the Referendum that extraordinary sense of excitement and ambition for our country which everyone felt.

My opponents are well funded. They know they’re fighting for their political lives. I need to raise the funds to conduct a high impact, professional campaign which will reach every voter in East Dunbartonshire.

Will you help?

John

JOHN NICOLSON is a journalist and broadcaster. He has reported for some of the BBC and ITV’s most high profile news and current affairs programmes including ‘Newsnight’, ‘Panorama’ and ‘Watchdog’. He was the main presenter on ‘BBC Breakfast’ and anchored BBC News 24 throughout the Twin Towers bombing.

As a print journalist his work has appeared in the ‘Observer’, ‘The Times’, ‘The Sunday Telegraph’, the ‘Herald’, and elsewhere.

Twitter @MrJohnNicolson
Facebook John Nicolson for East Dunbartonshire

Rules and conditions.
Donations of all sizes are very welcome

Donors of more than £50 please contact us at: EastDunbartonshireSNP@yahoo.co.uk                                                                                     with your name and address as this is a legal requirement.

We are not allowed to accept donations of more than £50 from anyone not on the United Kingdom electoral roll.

Promoted by Cllr Gordan Low on behalf of John Nicolson, both of 59 Townhead, Kirkintilloch, G66 1NN.

voters have a decision to make.

We have real power in our hands.

Westminster still controls Scotland’s foreign and defence policies, and Scotland’s
budget. It will decide whether or not we spend £100 billion replacing Trident.

Westminster will decide whether we have sufficient funds for our education
system and NHS.

So Westminster matters.

The polls show that in East Dunbartonshire the SNP are favourites to win. Voters
– whether they were Yes or No supporters in the Referendum – trust the SNP to
fight Scotland’s corner at Westminster if, as looks likely, there’s another hung
parliament.

Between now and May I want to run a high profile, optimistic campaign carrying
forward from the Referendum that extraordinary sense of excitement and
ambition for our country which everyone felt.

My opponents are well funded. They know they’re fighting for their political
lives. I need to raise the funds to conduct a high impact, professional campaign
which will reach every voter in East Dunbartonshire.

Will you help? 
John

JOHN NICOLSON is a journalist and broadcaster. He has reported for some of the
BBC and ITV’s most high profile news and current affairs programmes including
‘Newsnight’, ‘Panorama’ and ‘Watchdog’. He was the main presenter on ‘BBC
Breakfast’ and anchored BBC News 24 throughout the Twin Towers bombing.


As a print journalist his work has appeared in the ‘Observer’, ‘The Times’, ‘The
Sunday Telegraph’, the ‘Herald’, and elsewhere.

Twitter @MrJohnNicolson
Facebook John Nicolson for East Dunbartonshire






Rules and conditions.
Donations of all sizes are very welcome

Donors of more than £50 please contact us at: EastDunbartonshireSNP@yahoo.co.uk                                                                                     with your name and address as this is
a legal requirement.

We are not allowed to accept donations of more than £50 from anyone not on the
United Kingdom electoral roll.


Promoted by Cllr Gordan Low on behalf of John Nicolson, both of 59 Townhead, Kirkintilloch, G66 1NN.

story:
Short Summary

Our dream is to create a place where people can learn about herbal medicine while learning how to get healthy. This March, our dreams became a reality: We are building Wellspring Mountain on the grounds of a former youth camp in northern North Carolina. In addition to classroom space and lodging, the property includes a 450-acre nature preserve.

We need your help in funding the remodeling, trail maintenance, woodland gardens, greenhouses, and other amenities. With your help we will create a successful holistic education and retreat center. You can see the classes we have already scheduled by going to www.wellspringmountain.com.

Who We Are

Thomas Easley is an herbalist, author and teacher with almost two decades of experience in the natural health world. Steven Horne is professional member and past president of the American Herbalists Guild with over 35 years experience as an herbalist and educator. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000 to start the remodeling process and have the doors open by summer. By the time we open we expect to be able to host 75 people comfortably, including class space, lodging and meals.

We have a variety of great perks, including books, discounted classes, retreats, and camping packages. We’ve already scheduled many of the best herbalists and educators in the country to do weekend intensives, and we are adding skills classes daily. Some of the classes already on the schedule include Pulse Diagnosis with Matthew Wood, Traditional Appalachian Folk Medicine with Phyllis Light, Herbal Wilderness First Aid with Sam Coffman, Dental Health with Leslie Alexander, and Traditional Western Constitution with Jim McDonald.

If we don’t reach our full funding goal, the funds we raise will still go towards the opening and maintenance of the center.

Stretch goals 

What if we exceed $25K?

The camp and nature preserve has been vacant for four years. There are miles of hiking trails that need to be restored, a shower house that could use a makeover, and additional log cabins to be built. Eventually, we would like to move towards energy self-sufficiency with solar and wind power.

The Impact

We believe that living in harmony with our natural surroundings and community is key to sustaining life for future generations. Many of us have lost the skills our ancestors had, skills that emphasize self-reliance and the empowerment of community. Through teaching skills such as herbal medicine, sustainable wild crafting, healthy cooking, gardening, primitive engineering, and wilderness survival, we at Wellspring Mountain can help to pave the way for a more sustainable future.



We need you to help make this vision a reality. Contribute now, take a class in the future, or just come hike in nature with us. We look forward to working with you! 

Risks & Challenges

Many of our instructors and classes for the coming year are booked. In the event that an instructor cancels, we will give you the option to take another weekend class of equal value or to reschedule your visit when that instructor has been rescheduled.

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the best things you can do to help us reach our goal is to share this campaign via social media. 

Just click on the icons below to help us spread the word.

story:
Our campaign has ended and we would like to thank all our supporters. Although we didn't reach our goal, we keep on working to make it happen! Day by day, we are building our new "home". Thanks to our Silver Sponsor "Evridiki Spa Solutions" that provided us with the appropriate flooring, our space is already transforming into a beautiful studio! Have a look!


.......

animate: to bring to life; revive, refresh; inspire; to fill with boldness or courage...

Καλημέρα! Διαβάστε το κείμενο μας στα Ελληνικά πιο κάτω!

Bonjour a tous! Le texte en français plus bas...

Hola! Ciao!Hallo!

You can also read the text in German if you scroll down.

Hello to everyone around the world! This is an open call to all of you that want to engage into a common vision coming true: a vision for culture and society through touristic development. But let’s take it from the beginning: read our story and who we are. Find out where we are today, how far we are willing to go and what we dream of reaching…

Our Story

We are Fanis, Eirini,  Alex, Harris and Vassilis and we all come from different backgrounds: arts and culture, social sciences and entrepreneurship. But also, we all believe in powerful experiences and people reaching their full potential through collaboration.

We shared our concerns, experiences and hard-earned knowledge. We talked about youth unemployment, a fragmented cultural scene in Greece and young performing artists and graduates from gymnastics schools fighting by themselves to fulfill their dreams. At the same time, we observed visitors in Greece from all over the world who look for experiencing something different and unique other than the beautiful climate and the sea.

What if all those people met somewhere in common?

For that, we created “Greek Animators”: a vibrant community of performing artists of all kinds, traditional or contemporary, local or global, dancers, musicians, actors, and many more, that aim to offer unforgettable cultural experiences, such as interactive shows, recreational activities and imaginative performances for all ages, to travellers, hotel guests and tourists who wish to meet the true contemporary cultural action in Greece and most of all… enjoy their stay to the maximum and have lots of fun!

Our vision

We envision “Greek Animators” as the National Team for Culture and Tourism. We reached out and all of a sudden we’ve gathered dozens of people, from street dancers and musicians to rhythmic gymnastics athletes and theatre groups that are in fact… forming the largest animators’ community in Greece!

How it works

Our community is open, constantly inviting and embracing new people and collaborations that enlarge its possibilities. We aim to highlight upcoming cultural groups and all the fresh and evolving talent in Greece. We focus on Greek history and cultural tradition in our happenings but also combine it with contemporary international elements that flourish now days in our country. That way, we promote an authentic view of the newest cultural activity in Greece.

Where we are today

Today, we are in the process of forming a Social Cooperative Enterprise in order to be able to sustain and develop “Greek Animators”, fight youth unemployment in the sector of performing arts and culture, by developing innovative happenings for the sector of tourism. Of course, locals are also very welcomed to attend our events!

What we need

We have already found the ideal space to house our offices and the absolutely necessary trainings, rehearsals and seminars. We’ve started repairing it with our hands, but we can’t get very far without your support.

Your contribution to appropriately forming our space and maintaining it for the first three months of our incubation period is invaluable.

Have a look of how it looks now…



…and imagine how we can transform it together into a vibrant space full of life and creative people getting together and collaborating for a greater cause!

What we give

We provide our contributors with an “insider’s” engagement to what we are doing. Plus, discounts and offers on our activities, as well as exceptional "soul gadgets"! Read all about it under “Perks”! Here is a taste of our musical "soul gadget" by the amazing "String Demons".


Why a flexible campaign

Our expenses budget consists of different pieces: appropriate flooring, a new ceiling, 1st month of rent, 2nd month and so on… This is why every single contribution is important even if we don’t reach our entire goal. But the more people contribute into "Greek Animators", the more we strengthen our vision.

A personal note

Most of you know that dreams do not come true that easily and some times our efforts surpass us. First steps are the hardest. But we are certain that where we give our efforts into are worth it and that we’ll work really hard into making it a reality. We remain devoted to something that will better our lives and the lives of other people. At first, it might seem small but we know that together, we can make it big.

Thank you.

Many special thanks to the friends that helped with the making of our campaign video: Costas, Michalis from Athens, Michalis from Crete. And, of course, to all the artists participating in the video.

Είμαστε οι GreekAnimators και στέλνουμε έναν εγκάρδιο χαιρετισμό σε ολόκληρο τον κόσμο! Το όραμα μας είναι να δημιουργήσουμε τη μεγαλύτερη ομάδα πολιτισμού και εμψύχωσης στην Ελλάδα, στοχεύοντας στον κλάδο του τουρισμού και καταπολεμώντας την ανεργία των νέων στον κλάδο της πολιτιστικής δραστηριότητας.

Φανταστείτε μια Εθνική Ομάδα Πολιτισμού Τουρισμού, μια μεγάλη κοινότητα που αγκαλιάζει όλες τις τέχνες, τον χορό, την μουσική, το θέατρο, που υποστηρίζει και προωθεί την παράδοση μας, αλλά και τον αυθεντικό σύγχρονο παλμό του πολιτιστικού γίγνεσθαι στην Ελλάδα σήμερα. Σε θέατρα και ιστορικά σημεία, σε ξενοδοχεία και τουριστικούς προορισμούς, στοχεύουμε να αναδείξουμε τον πολιτισμό ως την μεγαλύτερη αξία του τόπου μας.

Γι’ αυτό το σκοπό, δημιουργούμε μια Κοινωνική Συνεταιριστική Επιχείρηση και έχουμε ήδη βρει τον ιδανικό χώρο για να στεγάσει το όραμα μας. Χρειαζόμαστε όμως τη συνεισφορά σας, για να τον διαμορφώσουμε κατάλληλα ώστε όλοι οι καλλιτέχνες, οι χορευτές και ηθοποιοί, οι γυμναστές και οι εμψυχωτές να συγκεντρώνονται για τις απαραίτητες πρόβες και σεμινάρια.

Γνωρίζουμε καλά ότι κάθε αρχή μπορεί να είναι δύσκολη, αλλά παραμένουμε αφοσιωμένοι και εργαζόμαστε σκληρά για τον σκοπό μας. Γιατί πάνω απ’ όλα, είναι στο χέρι όλων μας να πράξουμε σήμερα, για ένα πιο όμορφο αύριο.

Από τα βάθη της καρδιάς μας, σας ευχαριστούμε για την υποστήριξη σας.

Ειρήνη, Φάνης, Αλέξης, Χάρης και Βασίλης

Un salut cordial au monde entier, de “Greek Animators”! Notre grande ambition est de créer la plus grande communauté pour la culture, l'animation et le tourisme en Grèce. Notre objectif est de lutter contre le chômage des jeunes dans le secteur culturel.

Imaginez un groupe National de Culture et Tourisme, qui embrasse tous les arts, la danse, la musique, le théâtre, qui soutient et favorise notre tradition, et en même temps montre l'authenticité de la vie culturelle en Grèce aujourd'hui.

Dans les théâtres et sites historiques, dans les hôtels et destinations touristiques, nous cherchons à mettre en évidence la culture, comme la plus grande valeur de notre lieu.

A cet effet, nous créons une entreprise coopérative sociale et nous avons déjà trouvé l'espace idéal pour réaliser nos projets. Mais nous avons besoin de votre contribution, pour aménager l'espace approprié pour que tous les artistes, danseurs et acteurs, formateurs et animateurs, se réunissent pour les répétitions et séminaires nécessaires.

Nous savons que chaque commencement peut être difficile, mais nous restons déterminés et travaillons avec passion pour notre but. Parce que surtout,c’ est à nous tous de faire aujourd'hui, pour un plus beau lendemain.

Du fond de nos cœurs, nous vous remercions pour votre soutien.

de “Greek Animators”: Eirini, Fanis, Alex, Harris at Vassilis


Wir sind Animatoren aus Griechenland und begrüßen aus ganzem Herzen die ganze Welt. Unsere Vision ist die Gründung der  größtenKultur- und Animations-Gruppe in Griechenland, die zur Förderung der Tourismuswirtschaft, sowie auch zur Bekämpfung der Jugendarbeitslosigkeit im Kulturbereich in Griechenland dienen soll. Stellen Sie sich eine nationale Kultur- und Tourismusgruppe vor. Einegroße Gemeinschaft, die alle Künste wie Tanz, Musik und Theater umfasst. Eine Gemeinschaft, die nicht nur unsere Tradition, sondern auch die zeitgenössische kulturelle Szene in Griechenland unterstützt und fördert.
Unser Plan wäre, in Theatern und historischen Stätten, in Hotels und touristischen Orten  die Kultur als größten Wert unseres Landes hervorzuheben.

Um dieses Ziel zu erreichen, gründen wir eine soziale Genossenschaft.

Dafür brauchen wir aber einen geeigneten Platz, wo alle Künstler, obTänzer oder Schauspieler, sich treffen können, um die nötigen Proben und Seminare durchführen zu können.

Wir wissen sehr gut, dass aller Anfang schwer ist, aber um dieses Ziel zu erreichen, arbeiten wir mit Hingabe und sehr hart. 

Es liegt übrigens an uns, heute für eine bessere Zukunft zu handeln.

Wir bedanken uns herzlich bei Ihnen für Ihre Unterstützung.

MitfreundlichenGrüßen

Die Gruppe der Greek Animators

Irini,Fanis,Alexis, Haris und Wassilis

story:
Short Summary

We failed to reach our goal in our first campaign so we will reach out again.  The Project Piggery Part 2 will enable the Orphanage children to become self-reliant by learning how to take care of pigs, run a small business and provide food for the orphanage.  Funds earned from the piggery will support secondary education for the children and other small scale activities.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to build a substantial building to house our pigs. The area around the orphanage is home to hyena and wild animals so we must build a concrete block building to protect our livestock. Most of the labor will be done by local folks.

  • Money will be used to buy building materials - see specific needs list in our Gallery.
  • We will purchase 20 piglets to get the project started. 
  • As the pigs mature and reproduce, we will sell some to raise money for school fees for the children.
  • We will be able to eat some of the pigs to add protein to the childrens' diet in addition to what we grow in our garden.
  • You will get the satisfaction of knowing you are helping a child take their place in the world as a confident and productive citizen.
  • You will help a child get a head start when they move out of the Orphanage Center at 18 years of age. They will have a pig and a chicken to get them started on their own self sufficiency.

The Impact

The pigs will be sold at appropriate ages and money will be banked. The interest earned will be used to buy more pigs which will lead to extension of the project. Sale of pigs will also help provide for secondary school fees for the children. Some of the pigs will provide food for the orphanage.  The project will promote and encourage thrift and a sustainable life style among the orphans and the neighboring community. The Piggery Project will offer the children the confidence and encouragement to discover that they can do more for themselves. They can start their own income generating activities which will lead to self-employment.

Risks & Challenges

Geita is an area which is highly affected by HIV/AIDS, malaria and dysentery. The major reason for the spread of the pandemic is due to the presence of the gold mine and trans-road to Uganda, Rwanda and Burundi. Therefore, there is a growing number of orphans. As a means of assisting most of these marginalized children, the Diocese of Geita built the Orphanage Centre. Currently there are 100 orphans at the Centre. The Diocese takes care of their full board. It costs about US $1,000.00 per year to feed, clothe, house and educate each child at the Centre. 

In order to continue with this mission and to open the door on the possibility of further assistance to other orphans, the Diocese welcomes generous donations towards the full boarding, school fees and tuition for our beloved children. 

  • Your donation will help provide sustenance and an education to these needy children.
  • The Moyo wa Huruma Piggery Project can become self-sustaining through a successful Indiegogo campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Challenge your friends to donate the cost of two lunches to the project.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and post our campaign on Twitter and Facebook!
  • Tag two Friends on Facebook and challenge them to give just $10 and pass it on by tagging two of their friends to tag and give $10.

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:

What We Need & What You Get We need $10,000 to build a substantial building to house our pigs. The area around the orphanage is home to hyena and wild animals so we must build a concrete block building to protect our livestock. Most of the labor will be done by local folks.  Money will be used to buy building materials - see specific needs list in our Gallery.  We will purchase 20 piglets to get the project started. 
As the pigs mature and reproduce, we will sell some to raise money for school fees for the children.

story: Hello!
story_txt: Hello!

story:
Our Story

I'm Baruch and this campaign is intended to raise money for me to buy a beautiful piece of land in Vermont to make a permaculture home for myself and a few friends. This is 15+ acres for $100,000 which includes a structure ready to be made livable. I need $25,000 for the 25% down payment. I have raised $5,000 so far! 

The plan for this land is to love it, learn from it, care for it, grow food, be sustainable; to live lightly as we engage in our various occupations, which are focused on making things better for Life on Earth.

I am a person who seeks to do good in the world.  One of my projects is a radio show that I produce/host  called Paradigms.  It doesn't provide a paycheck but it does reach out to thousands of people around the world with inspiration, ideas, information, and great music.

I offer what I have, my skills and talents, often without financial remuneration.  I am fine with that.  Money is not what's important to me in this life, which is part of why I don't have the money for this down payment in hand myself.  I live as much as I can by sharing.  I share what I have and others share with me.  There are others who will also live on this land who are contributing money, time, effort, for whom this home will also be important.

If we are able to pull this off, it will be yet one more permaculture homestead in the world where cultural creatives are doing their thing.  That's good!

View the land on Google Maps.

The Impact

This will be a home for myself and some other folks.  The plan is to "permaculture it up!"  This place has so much going for it; southern exposure, water, a pond, a 2-story 2-car garage structure w/a little studio attached, a septic tank, power, open space for gardening and animals, woods for exploring.  It will not take long to get things up and running for energy efficient living, growing food, composting, etc. There will be yurts and a greenhouse in the near future.

This will also be a place where people can come for some peace and quiet, for ceremonies, to have weddings and memorials and other rituals.  We will also make herbal products like salves and tinctures, fabric items like clothes and hand made dolls, and more.

The impact of supporting this project can best be described as many ripples going out into the world from many stones scattered into a pond.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $25,000 for the downpayment.  Contributions of any size will help.  I have raised $5000 so far, $20,000 to go!  The other 75% will be in the form of  owner financing with payments that I can comfortably manage with my current income and rent from other folks who will live on the land. The whole thing is very doable.

As a way to say thank you, everyone who donates $25 or more will get a jar of salve made from the plants of this land. Donors of $100 or more can also elect to receive a Bodywork Session with Baruch. There will be room to camp and eventually some indoor spaces, and lots of gardens and hikes and loveliness, so you are also invited to visit!

By contributing to this project you become a part of it.  Money is energy.  By putting your energy into this, no matter the amount, you are putting part of yourself into it.  I find that to be very exciting; many people making something happen. Even the smallest of donations makes a difference and brings your energy into the project.

If you are interested in contributing beyond this campaign or would like to be involved in some other way, or have any questions, please email Baruch. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by donating and you can also help by telling your friends, and asking them to tell their friends; by being excited about this project and letting that excitement give you a buzz! If you are part of any network of people, please feel free to share this project in your network. 


By March 16 if, between this campaign and other fund raising efforts, I am not able to do the land deal, all contributions will be returned.
