story:
April 25, 2015 

11:56 NST,  7.8 Magnitude Earthquake 
The epicenter hit the Gorkha district and the damage and devastation was widespread throughout Nepal, including Kathmandu. 

Over 7,000 people have lost their lives, and nearly 100,000 homes were destroyed. The people of Nepal are seeking shelter in tents and are in desperate need of basic life necessities. Let us band together and help them. 

If you are already a part of the Nepal Volunteers Council (NVC) family, then you have a deep connection to this beautiful country. If not, now is a great time to get to know us, because we need your help now, more than ever. Please consider donating to help us help our people. 

Funds raised from this campaign will go to immediate relief efforts. If you want to know more about us and who we are, and what we usually do, please visit our webpage: http://www.volunteerscouncil.org.np/

story:
We are heartbroken beyond words to see the continual loss and devastation in Nepal and are grateful to be in a position to help the people of this country.

Nepal, still reeling from the 7.8 magnitude earthquake on April 25, 2015 that killed more than 8,000 and caused over 100 aftershocks - was jolted again from a second earthquake. 

Thousands of frightened people are sleeping outdoors after this second 7.3 magnitude earthquake killed dozens of people on May 12, 2015. Hundreds of thousands are now homeless; striking the hardest in the foothills of the Himalayas and triggering landslides that blocked roads to remote villages in several districts including the hardest hit Sindhupalchowk region.

An estimated 2.8 million Nepalese are displaced. The quake leveled entire villages in the upper hills and mountainous regions leaving hundreds of thousands of small farmers homeless.

While information is still coming in about the extent of the damage, officials are learning that thousands of schools have been destroyed and that tens of thousands of classrooms will need replacing.

“Almost one million children enrolled in school before the earthquake may now find there is no school building to return to,” said Tomoo Hozumi, Unicef's representative in Nepal. “Prolonged interruption to education can be devastating for children’s development and future prospects.”

The total cost of repairs is expected to be $6 billion, equivalent to about 30% of Nepal's annual economic output. 100% of funds raised will go to relief and rebuild efforts in Nepal.

JSF, Jiwanko Saathiharu: Jeremy Saxe Foundation for Education and Development, Inc.

Jiwanko Saathiharu means friends of Jeremy and also friends of life (While living in Nepal Jeremy was given the Nepali name, Jiwan, which means “life”). 

Our Foundation, a US 501(c)(3) non-profit, founded in 2008 after the sudden and unexpected, tragic death of Jeremy Saxe from hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Jeremy, an Orange, CT resident and Amity Regional High School graduate, was a senior at Lafayette College and had just returned from a transformational semester abroad in Nepal. He was compelled to return to Nepal and commit his future to education and development work to alleviate the gross disparities he witnessed while he was there.

Nepal’s warm and generous people are rich in culture and spirituality, but impoverished from a lack of quality education, a ten year civil war and political instability. 

The JSF Foundation has made 5 trips to Nepal, toured numerous schools and met with many INGOs, NGOS, as well as UNICEF, UNDP and Nepal’s Ministry of Education. Although the needs were great before the earthquake, obstacles we have encountered include corruption and most surprisingly from some, a lack of interest in working toward exceptional education. It has been challenging to find partners in Nepal who share Jeremy’s values.

Although the process has been long, the advantages gained through relationships developed over this period of time have encouraged us to remain committed to our values and our mission. We know it is what Jeremy would have wanted.

An exceptionally bright light amidst our growing relationships has been Teach for Nepal. Foundation officers spent 3 days with Teach for Nepal in February of 2014; a few pictures are included in the campaign gallery.

Teach For Nepal:

Teach for Nepal's philosophy to recruit university graduates (most Nepalese teachers have a 10th grade education) and train the Fellows, not just as exceptional teachers, but as change-agents and community leaders, aligning precisely with the values of Jer’s legacy foundation. The Teach for Nepal Fellows commit to two years of teaching at some of the most impoverished schools in Nepal where they homestay in the village. After two years of Fellowship they are expected to emerge as leaders and develop innovative solutions to end education inequity from inside and outside the education system.

Following this disaster, the Teach for Nepal team launched a "Reach to Relief" campaign. Through 28 placement schools in Sindupalchowk and Lalitpur, they have been able to reach over 100 communities and initial relief supplies of food, medicine and tents have been delivered. These passionate TFN Fellows reached the most devastated villages after the first quake and in many villages they were the first responders. They are a group who share the Jeremy Saxe Foundation's values and are truly dedicated to "service above self.” The second phase will be rehabilitation and reconstruction of the schools that were affected.

All funds received:

All funds received from this campaign will go directly to Teach for Nepal’s “Reach to Relief" and rebuild campaign.  Please see below to see what is needed now.

The story that compelled us to launch this campaign:

Babita Kushwaha, a Teach for Nepal Fellow working in Sindhupalchowk’s Nawalpur Village, survived the massive earthquake on April 25, 2015. We knew we had to help when we learned she witnessed 40 bodies being pulled from the rubble, including her students and one of her colleagues. We were devastated to hear that no relief was reaching the village.

Read about Babita's impact with Teach for Nepal in the Nepali Times article: Back to the Village; her exceptional leadership enabled the first round of essentials to reach her village - you can see photos in the gallery section of this campaign.

What you should know about us:

We are a US 501(c)(3) registered non profit Federal EIN # 26-3345574.  JSF employs one person, an In Country Manager who reports to our volunteer In Country Director and Board member in Nepal. His salary is paid through a dedicated grant we received to cover expenses in Nepal. JSF has 9 board members; 2 live in Nepal. 

In the United States, the Foundation is an entirely volunteer operation with no overhead expenses incurred and all the Foundation's travel expenses are paid personally by the Saxe family, as well as the processing costs of this campaign. 100% of all donations from this campaign will be received by Teach for Nepal’s program to provide relief and rebuilding in the communities where their Fellows teach and live. The foundation also supports an annual scholarship at Amity Regional High School.

How much should you donate? 

Please donate whatever you can; every single dollar makes a difference and be assured that 100% of your donation will reach the 

Nepal Earthquake survivors.

Your contributions and prayers are much appreciated!

With love and gratitude,

Heidi & Tracy Saxe and, of course, Jer : )

Jiwanko Saathiharu: Jeremy Saxe Foundation for Education and Development, Inc. 

US 501(c)(3) registered non profit Federal EIN # 26-3345574 

Donations are tax-deductible to the full extent of the law.

What We Need: 

  • Increased substantial temporary housing to protect families from the heavy monsoon rains that start in June and continue through August - September
  • Minimum three month supply of food
  • Toilets - diarrhea outbreaks are currently happening and the WHO is anticipating a cholera outbreak as well
  • Temporary schools to keep children safe and provide post- traumatic stress counseling and activities. Nepal schools are scheduled to resume on May 29, 2015
  • Rebuild of schools

The Impact:

Most relief efforts have been focused in Kathmandu. This will bring relief to under-served communities and villages most severely impacted by the earthquake.

Risks & Challenges:

Damaged roads

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share this campaign - the needs continue to rise!

story:
Short Summary

Aanii! We are a dynamic duo looking to represent our communities at the 7th Annual Healing Our Spirit Worldwide Conference hosted this year in Hamilton, New Zealand. 

Here is the link to the conference website: http://hosw.com/

We are excited to be selected as presenters on a panel which discusses Indigenous Solutions to promoting Health and Wellbeing and have we been working diligently in our communities to share strategies that incorporate Indigenous knowledge and practices in the field of health promotion.

This campaign is important to us because we believe that Indigenous knowledge and practices have always supported holistic wellbeing and we are eager to share our experiences and learn from other practitioners in the global Indigenous community.

Your help will support our vision of promoting holistic wellness using traditional knowledge and practices; in the spirit of giving and sharing we would like to offer our sponsors a small token of our appreciation in the form of a handmade gift from the two of us.  We are also offering, upon our return from New Zealand, the opportunity to share our presentation on Living Minobimaadiziwin with you free of cost.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $2250.00 towards the cost of our accommodations and meals (we are staying at the University of Waikato in the student residence to help alleviate some costs. Our room is 125.00/night x 9 nights)
  • We estimate that the cost of our meals will be 60.00/day x 10 days for a total of 1200.00 for two people
  • We are looking to fundraise a total of 3500.00
  • To each of our sponsors we are sharing a handmade gift as a token of our appreciation and/or the opportunity to share our presentation "Living Minobimaadiziwin" with your school/organization/community
  • In the event that we are unable to reach our goal of $5000.00 all funds raised will contribute to offsetting a portion of our overall travel  costs. 

The Impact

Your contribution is valuable to the sharing of Indigenous solutions to health and wellness and leadership development.  We hope to bring back with us new tools and resources to help us in our current  field of health promotion and in our roles as community leaders.

We provide relevant and engaging workshops to our community schools and organizations that incorporate traditional knowledge and practices to prevent and combat chronic illness and poverty; our workshops focus on healthy physical activities that reconnect Indigenous peoples with their lands and territories and provide Indigenous families with food skills and access to healthy nutrition to address food insecurity due to poverty.  Our food and nutrition workshops promote the use Indigenous foods and medicines to empower our clients to be self-sufficient.

Miigwech for your support and contribution! Your help will bring us closer to our dream of sharing Anishinaabe teachings with our Indigenous brothers and sisters from around the globe.

We are a dynamic duo looking to represent our communities at the 7th Annual Healing Our Spirit Worldwide Conference hosted this year in Hamilton, New Zealand.  Here is the link to the conference website: http://hosw.com/We are excited to be selected as presenters on a panel which discusses Indigenous Solutions to promoting Health and Wellbeing and have we been working diligently in our communities to share strategies that incorporate Indigenous knowledge and practices in the field of health promotion.  This campaign is important to us because we believe that Indigenous knowledge and practices have always supported holistic wellbeing and we are eager to share our experiences and learn from other practitioners in the global Indigenous community. Your help will support our vision of promoting holistic wellness using traditional knowledge and practices; in the spirit of giving and sharing we would like to offer our sponsors a small token of our appreciation in the form of a handmade gift from the two of us.  We are also offering, upon our return from New Zealand, the opportunity to share our presentation on Living Minobimaadiziwin with you free of cost.    What We Need & What You Get 
$2250.00 towards the cost of our accommodations and meals (we are staying at the University of Waikato in the student residence to help alleviate some costs. Our room is 125.00/night x 9 nights)
We estimate that the cost of our meals will be 60.00/day x 10 days for a total of 1200.00 for two people 
We are looking to fundraise a total of 3500.00  To each of our sponsors we are sharing a handmade gift as a token of our appreciation and/or the opportunity to share our presentation "Living Minobimaadiziwin" with your school/organization/community
In the event that we are unable to reach our goal of $5000.00 all funds raised will contribute to offsetting a portion of our overall travel  costs.     The Impact Your contribution is valuable to the sharing of Indigenous solutions to health and wellness and leadership development.  We hope to bring back with us new tools and resources to help us in our current  field of health promotion and in our roles as community leaders.  We provide relevant and engaging workshops to our community schools and organizations that incorporate traditional knowledge and practices to prevent and combat chronic illness and poverty; our workshops focus on healthy physical activities that reconnect Indigenous peoples with their lands and territories and provide Indigenous families with food skills and access to healthy nutrition to address food insecurity due to poverty.  Our food and nutrition workshops promote the use Indigenous foods and medicines to empower our clients to be self-sufficient.Miigwech for your support and contribution! Your help will bring us closer to our dream of sharing Anishinaabe teachings with our Indigenous brothers and sisters from around the globe.

story:
Pint of Science is landing in Canada

******

Une Pinte de Science débarque au Canada


English message will follow
Une Pinte de Science est une organisation à but non lucratif, dont le but est de sortir la Science des laboratoires et de la partager avec le grand public dans un cadre familier et détendu.
  • Une Pinte de Science est gérée par une communauté d'étudiants et de jeunes chercheurs.
  • Nos évènements se veulent sympas, accessibles et avant tout fascinants
  • Le public pourra rencontrer des experts expliquer leurs découvertes
  • Nous avons des partenariats avec différentes universités et instituts de recherche.

L’image de la science est bonne mais… l’image de l’enseignement des sciences doit être démystifiée.




On organise des rencontres entre des chercheurs et le public dans un bar.


Pour chaque soir, on choisit un thème, qui restera le même dans un bar donné, pour 3 soirs de suite.








On a besoin de VOUS pour nous aider à nous développer en cette première année !

Le Festival est amené a grandir, si vous êtes intéressé pour l'organiser dans votre ville au Canada, contactez nous.

Toute l’équipe de Pinte de Science Canada vous remercie pour le soutien !!!!



******


Pint of Science is landing in Canada


Pint of Science is a non-profit association, dedicated to bring the top research scientists out of their labs and celebrate science discovery with audience in pubs.

  • Pint of Science is managed by a community of students and researchers.

  • Our events are fun, accessible and most of all- fascinating.

  • Audience will meet experts in their fields explaining scientific discoveries.

  • We partner with universities and research institutions.


The Science has a good reputation, bu the image of science education has to be demystified.

We organize  meetings between Professors and the audience in pubs.


We will spend three nights in a row in a pub for a given theme.





We need YOU to help us developing Pint of Science in Canada.

The Festival will try to expand in many cities. Contact us if you are interested to bring Pint of Science to your city.

Pint of Science Canada Team thanks you for the support !!!

story:
WHO WE ARE:

We are Active Minds! A mental health advocacy and awareness group on campus, we seek to empower students to engage in dialogue about mental health and to bring that dialogue to a larger arena by advocating for real, systematic change on campus. The world today is not kind to our mental health and millions suffer for it. We intend to change the way things are done, but we need your help to do it!


WHAT IS THE JCK FOUNDATION:

The JCK Foundation was founded in honor of John Kelly, a young man with OCD who took his life at the age of 24. His childhood friend John Tessitore, inspired by Kelly, his experience, and the impact that it had on him, began this foundation with the goal of raising awareness about the effects of OCD and other mental disorders. The Legends Speaking Tour is a nationwide tour currently in process that tells the story of John Kelly and the JCK Foundation. We believe students at SU would benefit tremendously from having an opportunity to attend this event, and the energy and momentum of having the JCK Foundation on campus would be invaluable in propelling Active Minds forward in our mission. 


WHY WE NEED YOU:

There is a $500 speaker fee for this event which Active Minds cannot provide on our own, since we're a relatively new organization on campus. But we are entirely committed to bringing John and JCK to our university, so we are doing everything in our power to make it happen. With help from people who love us, believe in us, and want to support us (i.e. YOU!!), we're confident that we can raise enough!

story:
AnswerUS.com, a website where students, Americans, and government connect


OUR COUNTRY'S FUTURE IS IN THE HANDS OF OUR YOUTH

I want to thank you for taking the time to look at this campaign and hope you find it worthy of your consideration.  My name is Lionel Kull and I am one of the founders of AnswerUS.com.  I am a 60 year old American who has followed the political antics of our country for years.  I have chatted with the masses who all seem to say, "I wish there was something I could do to influence our politicians and help our country." Or I've also heard "I wish there was something I could do to make my children's future more bright."

Well now here  it  is, it’s called

AnswerUS.com is in beta right now and will be open to the American Public in November.  AnswerUS will be strongly encouraging student involvement and we will push for all schools with political science classes to take part.  More on the benefits of this below.

This Is Who We Are And What We Do

First off we are nonpartisan and committed to uniting this country.

There are 537 elected officials who control the lives of 320 million Americans.  On the website we have prepared an identity page for each official, which will be his platform to communicate with us.  Each week the American public will ask our elected officials questions of their concern.  You will either ask a new question or vote up a question which has already been asked.  The question with the most backing will become their “Question of the Week”.  He/She will then be given one week to answer their question.  When the question has been answered the public will then come back and rate the answer for accuracy.  This will give the official and honesty rating of 1-100.  During election years we will also have a page set up for the challengers.  All answers will be saved on the official’s page for posterity and future reference.

Should the official decide not to answer, it will be highlighted on his/her page that he/she did not answer and a fyi will be sent out to over one hundred national media sites reporting so. 

The politicians we have contacted so far seem to like the idea which we are presenting.  Most like relating to the American people, especially without a microphone or camera stuck in their face.  Having a week to answer, making sure what they are saying is right, seems to be a format for which the time has finally come.  We at AnswerUs.com feel that this new found cooperation between the American public and our politicians may take some of the power away from corporations and special interest groups and give it back to the people.  Maybe congress and the American public will work together again and their 7% approval rating will rise. 

What This Means To Students

We at AnswerUS.com feel it is imperative to get our younger generation involved in our government at an early age.  The future of the nation rest on their shoulders.  AnswerUS.com is not only about students but also all Americans.  We are creating an interaction with our politicians which will create and unfiltered communication tool between we the people and our elected officials. 

AnwserUS can be implemented in the political science classes of the high schools throughout America.  This would be a wonderful education tool.  Students would be asked to bring their individual question to class where it can be discussed along with all other questions.  The class would decide which question is worthy enough to become the question of the week and become submitted to AnswerUS.  As the question  rises in popularity within the national questions, points will be awarded and  accumulated .  The top classes per state and the top 5 per country will be awarded with computers, laptops, Ipads, e books, etc. , which will be presented to the school.  

The students learn in various ways.  They must research current events so as to come up with a question. They participate in a class discussion when grading the classmates questions.  The students will also gather current information from viewing the questions from the American people.  Last but not least they will experience responses from the elected officials.  

AnswerUS.com believes there is a strong disconnect today between Washington and the American people.  We believe we own the formula for getting our elected officials to answer questions that are asked by the American people and the students of our schools.  It is now time that America once again becomes a country of the people, by the people, and for the people.

What We Need & What You Get

As of this date, we are nearing completion of the website and we are in beta testing right now.  We plan on the site going live in November 2014.  None of the founders are coders so we hired a Minneapolis firm to build this site.  We feel they have done a remarkable job and are so looking forward to presenting it the American public.  The estimates to complete the site to live date was $250,000.  The funds provided so far have all been private.  We do however need future funding for our future endeavors to help make the most of this new and exciting venue.  Phase II will include the building of a mobile app and preparing extensively for the 2016 elections.  The Presidential election of 2016 should see exciting changes where we anticipate using AnswerUS.com questions for debates on our platform.  We also envision using only questions asked from the American people on AnswerUS.com instead of media driven questions. 

How It Works (Brief)

How It Works (Detailed)

•First you start by think of a burning question you want to ask to a certain individual in office.

•Next you think of a category you wish to have that question under. (Listed below are the categories you can choose from)

•Once you have the previous two bullet points figured out, you simply click on the "Ask A Question" tab.

After you have clicked the "Ask A Question" tab, you will be able to locate which official you want by either name, state, and office.

•Along with that you can also select the category you want the question to go under along with the actual question itself.

•Also during election years, you can ask any challenger a question just as you would ask any of our elected officials. His/Her name will have an "Orange C" next to their name to indicate they are a challenger.

•After submitting your question, the site will bring you to your personal question on the elected official's page. Along with this, you have the option to view their full profile, all the questions asked from them, share on social media button, or even ask another official the same exact question. 

•This is how it will look for an Incumbent. 

•This is how it will look for a challenger. 

•From there, you can click on Browse Questions and it will show you all of the questions that have been asked, and will also show the amount of votes a question has received.

•At the end of the week, the question that receives the most votes for each elected official/challenger will become his/her question of the week.

•They will then have a week to respond back. If they do respond back, the response will be displayed like the image below.

•If they do not respond, it will also be noted and will be displayed as the picture below.

•You can also keep asking the same question each week until that elected official finally answers.

•Each week there will be new questions and new answers which will generate interest to continue returning to the site.

The Impact

The way we see this is the American people need to embrace this site and spend just a small amount of time each week in the form of either asking a question or voting up an existing one.  That’s all that’s really needed.  If we can get several million people a week to do so we should improve America for the better.  Special interests and corporations will have to take a back seat to the American public.  We feel we owe this to our children, grandchildren, and to the future of this country.  All we ask of our elected officials is to keep us in the loop by answering the questions that are on our minds.  In doing so we may once again become a government of the people, by the people, and for the people.    

At AnswerUS.com we are endeavoring to relate to as many Americans as possible. To address this issue we intend to enroll the assistance of the national and local media, bloggers, friends, and just a healthy dose of social media.  Most of our time spent over the next 2 months will be telling the world that we exist and relaying our message to our elected officials.  With the response we have already received from politicians and individuals, we anticipate the elected officials will embrace the site as will the American public. We believe we can provoke a positive change in American politics that will elevate our system of government to the heights that have been only dreamed of.  We could have the answer to the question that I have heard so often over my many years, "What can I do about it?"

We have come up with the idea, bounced it off of so many people with so much positive feedback. Is this a political answer which could change our country?  With your help, we believe so.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We fully understand that there will be a huge number of you reading this that will like and understand what we are doing but don’t have the money to allocate to the cause.  That’s perfectly fine but we need to rely on you to help us in other ways.  If you can pass on this information to your inner circle of friends and relatives, that would be of great assistance!  Bringing forth questions that America needs answered will be a must do for all of us.  Our continued contact with our elected officials gives them a platform to relate to us and the feedback we have desperately been seeking.  Your opportunity is here to finally have your voice be heard and move America in a positive direction.  That of which is for the people, of the people and by the people.

    Prizes (How they will appear)

    Bluetooth Speaker- 


    Cell Phone Holder-


    Duffle Bag-

    Earbuds-


    Retro Handset-


    Our Team 

    Lionel Kull
    (Co-Founder)

    Todd Kelm
    (Co-Founder)

    Lynn Kull
    (Co-Founder)

    Shawn Kull
    (Co-Founder)

    Debbie Kull
    (Co-Founder)

    Amy Claude
    (Co-Founder)

    Jim Brownson
    (Co-Founder)

    Hadyn Kelm
    (Social Media Director)


    Thank You From The AnswerUS Team

story:
Short and Sweet Summary

Every summer, Rocky Ridge Music Center, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, brings approximately 150 young musicians ages 10-24 to attend our Junior Music Camps and our Young Artist Program.  Many of these students receive financial aid, but the need is always greater than our resources—and we have to turn away talented kids whose families cannot afford full tuition.  This makes everybody very sad, and this year we are determined to make more scholarship funding available, in order to bring to camp young musicians who will otherwise not be able to come!  In order to make this happen, we need YOU!

Who We Are

Located near Longs Peak and Rocky Mountain National Park, Rocky Ridge is one of the oldest residential summer music organizations in the nation. In 1942 Beth Miller Harrod, a pianist, sought a haven where young musicians would be able to immerse themselves in musical studies away from the daily distractions. She found that setting at the foot of Longs Peak, a place of unparalleled beauty.  With the high country as a backdrop, our campus includes the historic Hewes-Kirkwood Lodge and over 40 other structures functioning as a performance hall, practice rooms, teaching studios, a composition lab, and residential cabins.  In this unique setting, Harrod’s ideal of creating a serene place for an immersive experience joining music and nature lives on.

Today, our programs have grown to include virtually all areas of music study in orchestral instruments, piano, voice, composition, musical theater, and American roots music.  Our Junior Music Camp (ages 10-15) and Young Artist Program (ages 15-24) comprise the core of our youth programs.  Lasting from two to five weeks, respectively, these programs bring young musicians to our mountain campus for complete immersion in music and nature, and are designed both to enhance musical skills and to develop creativity, self awareness, and harmonious relationships.  Students leave with a great sense of confidence in their musical abilities which spills over into other areas of their lives, a collection of special memories that they have created for themselves within a nurturing community, and a network of friends who share a passion for music that support them long after their summer at Rocky Ridge is over.

Our Goal

Why $7,500?  This amount will allow us to make the following additional scholarships available:  two $2,000 full Junior scholarships for low-income students; four $250 partial Junior scholarships; and five $500 partial Young Artist scholarships.  Qualified students have already applied, and are waiting for your donation to the scholarship fund.  Summer is right around the corner, and our students need your help to make this happen quickly!

Spread the Word

Even if you can’t contribute to our scholarship fundraiser, you can help!  Share this campaign through social media or email, and help us tap into the power of the crowd . . . if enough people give a little, together we will achieve a lot!

turn away talented kids whose families cannot afford full
tuition.  This makes everybody very sad,
and this year we are determined to make more scholarship funding available, in
order to bring to camp young musicians who will otherwise not be able to come!  In order to make this happen, we need YOU!
Who We Are
Located near
Longs Peak and Rocky Mountain National Park, Rocky Ridge is one of the oldest
residential summer music organizations in the nation. In 1942 Beth Miller Harrod,
a pianist, sought a haven where young musicians would be able to immerse
themselves in musical studies away from the daily distractions. She found that
setting at the foot of Longs Peak, a place of unparalleled beauty.  With the high country as a backdrop, our
campus includes the historic Hewes-Kirkwood Lodge and over 40 other structures
functioning as a performance hall, practice rooms, teaching studios, a
composition lab, and residential cabins. 
In this unique setting, Harrod’s ideal of creating a serene place for an
immersive experience joining music and nature lives on.
Today, our
programs have grown to include virtually all areas of music study in orchestral
instruments, piano, voice, composition, musical theater, and American roots
music.  Our Junior Music Camp (ages
10-15) and Young Artist Program (ages 15-24) comprise the core of our youth
programs.  Lasting from two to five
weeks, respectively, these programs bring young musicians to our mountain
campus for complete immersion in music and nature, and are designed both to
enhance musical skills and to develop creativity, self awareness, and
harmonious relationships.  Students leave
with a great sense of confidence in their musical abilities which spills over into
other areas of their lives, a collection of special memories that they have
created for themselves within a nurturing community, and a network of friends
who share a passion for music that support them long after their summer at
Rocky Ridge is over.
Our Goal
Why $7,500?  This
amount will allow us to make the following additional scholarships
available:  two $2,000 full Junior
scholarships for low-income students; four $250 partial Junior scholarships;
and five $500 partial Young Artist scholarships.  Qualified students have already applied, and
are waiting for your donation to the scholarship fund.  Summer is right around the corner, and our
students need your help to make this happen quickly!
Spread the Word
Even if you can’t contribute to our scholarship fundraiser,
you can help!  Share this campaign
through social media or email, and help us tap into the power of the crowd . .
. if enough people give a little, together we will achieve a lot!

story:
Conócenos

Somos FUNDACION MUJER DE LUZ CHILE, pioneras en crear programas de Enseñanza, Yoga y Meditación para potenciar el Auto conocimiento, Desarrollo y Empoderamiento de cientos de Mujeres en situación de vulnerabilidad y riesgo en Chile desde hace cinco años.

SE PARTE DE LA TRANSFORMACION! Necesitamos recaudar 6000 USD (CLP $3.000.000) para ayudar a 200 mujeres que necesitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida de forma integral:

  • Mujeres que viven Violencia Intrafamiliar: Apoyo integral para el empoderamiento y así logren salir del ciclo de la violencia.
  • Mujeres Jefas de Hogar, cabezas de familia: Apoyo para potenciar su emprendimiento y liderazgo.
  • Adolescentes Embarazadas de escasos recursos: Ayuda integral para los períodos de pre y post natal, enseñando técnicas de auto cuidado, cuidado del bebé y educación en maternidad y paternidad.
  • Mujeres en situación de Cárcel: Ayuda a mujeres reclusas a través de programas que potencian la motivación al cambio para tratar su adicción a drogas.
-----------------------------------------

Get to know us

We are WOMEN LIGHT FOUNDATION CHILE, pioneers in creating programs for education, Yoga and Meditation to enhance the Self Development and Empowerment of hundreds of women that are in situations of vulnerability and risk in Chile for over five years. 

BE A PART OF THE TRANSFORMATION! We need to raise $6000 USD (CLP $3,000,000) to help 200 women who need to improve their living conditions holistically: 

  • Women Living with Domestic Violence: Comprehensive support for empowerment and the ability to break out of the cycle of violence. 
  • The Female Head of Household: Support to enhance their entrepreneurial and leadership. 
  • Pregnant Teens in Poverty: Comprehensive support for the critical periods of growth (pre and post natal), teaching self-care techniques, baby and parenthood education. 
  • Women at Jail: Help inmates through programs that enhance their motivation to change and to treat their addiction to drugs.

El impacto

  • SER PIONERAS ES UN DESAFIO. Día tras día nos inspiran las sonrisas de las mujeres a las que hemos ayudado a superar su dolor, depresión y traumas por experiencias vividas en su pasado y muchas veces en su presente. El Yoga y la Meditación hacen cambios profundos, verdaderos y duraderos en quienes lo practican, creando una mayor auto confianza, seguridad interna y fortaleza. Lo hemos visto en cada evaluación realizada en nuestros programas y confiamos en que podemos expandir esto a miles de mujeres!
  • CON TU CONTRIBUCION, nos acercamos más a poder crear talleres educativos que promuevan el auto respeto y dignidad de 200 mujeres que necesitan tu apoyo ahora.
  • TENEMOS CUATRO AñOS DE EXPERIENCIA trabajando bajo convenios de cooperación con SERNAM (Servicio Nacional de la Mujer), Municipalidad de Osorno y Centro Penitenciario Femenino San Joaquín.
--------------------------------------------

The Impact

  • BEING PIONEERS IS A CHALLENGE. Day after day we inspire women to smile by helping them to overcome the pain, depression and trauma they have experienced in their past and often in their present. Yoga and Meditation make a deep, real, and lasting change in those who practice it by creating greater self-confidence, inner security and strength. We have seen this to be true in all the socio-psychological assessments for our programs and we hope that we can expand this to reach thousands of women! 
  • WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION, we get closer to being able to create educational workshops that promote self-respect and dignity for 200 women who need your support now. 
  • WE HAVE FOUR YEARS OF EXPERIENCE working under cooperative agreements with SERNAM (National Service for Women), the Municipality of Osorno and the San Joaquin Female Prison. 

    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

    Comparte nuestro link a través de tus redes sociales! HAGAMOS RUIDO! 

    ---------------------------------------------

    Other ways you can help

    Share our link through your social networks! LET'S MAKE NOISE!

story:
They want to take down your ad

Queenslanders are standing up and sharing their stories about how these broken promises have impacted on them personally by getting out and about on the ground, by talking at community events and in their workplaces.

To add value to that we've been running some TV ads to take the message directly to Campbell Newman that it's time to start keeping your promises. 

Now, we've been asked to take down the ad. 

We know this government has form in trying to shut down debate, they've made it harder for Queenslanders to speak up, but still we're standing and fighting with you alongside us. 

The ads are having an impact. We've got the government's attention but now we need your help to keep them on air and take this campaign to the next level. 

Can you chip in today to help keep the ads on the air? 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We have a plan for change. Our TV ads have started, we've been told to take them down and we're ready to book more spots to ramp up the campaign.
  • Every extra dollar we get towards these ads is an extra dollar that goes towards getting our message across to Campbell Newman that Queenslanders have had enough of his broken promises. 
  • We'll be running TV ads, newspaper and online ads to ramp up this effort. 

You've done it before and can do it again

  • You've spoken up before and you can speak up again - chipping in shows that our services and our democracy cannot be bought. That defending free speech, in this instance the right of Queenslanders to call out the Premier for his broken promises is important enough to fight for. 
  • Last year you showed you cared for an Independent Judiciary in Queensland and the Fitzgerald reforms by funding ads. You helped add to the growing chorus of people who have shown that these assaults on freedom are just not on, a chorus that has now forced the government to tone down its rhetoric. https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/stand-with-t...

What's next

  • The TV ads alone will not change the landscape, we need people on the ground having conversations. We know Campbell Newman's government is getting millions from its mates in big business who stand to gain from privatised assets and services, that's why we need to get in now before the noise of the election. Our ads now can help shape the landscape and we can then have a real conversation with people as a result of our activist activities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

People are out and about for a better Queensland. We have doorknocking and phone activities coming up. You can find out more about getting involved today at http://www.howcanwetrustyou.org.au/index.php/co...

story:
Here in the Yorkshire & Humber region we would like to give every voter the opportunity to vote for a Green Party MP. In order for us to stand candidates we need to raise a deposit1 of £500 for each one. As you can imagine, with 54 parliamentary seats in our region alone, this is quite a substantial sum for our party to raise.

You may be aware that the larger parties often take large donations from big business interests, but the Green Party are not funded in that way. Our campaigns are powered by party members and supporters like you.

Please help us support your local parliamentary candidate by giving what you can. With donations starting at just £1 we hope everyone can get involved. Please note: if you decide to donate more than £50 we will need to take some additional details2 from you before we can accept your kind offer of support.

Should we fail to raise the required £500 deposit for this constituency we would try to transfer funds from better funded areas. This will be a reciprocal arrangement so if this campaign is over funded our team will try to support as may other local candidates as possible. After funding deposits across the region, any remaining funds will be returned to the originating constituency, to support their campaigning efforts.

If you feel you are not able to contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and family, sharing our page (www.yorkshiregreen2015.com) on social media and following the campaign on Facebook and Twitter (links below) to stay up to date with progress. You can also volunteer to help the Green Party campaign by signing up here http://greenparty.org.uk/getinvolved/

Finally, of course, don’t forget that your vote counts on May 7th!

Many thanks for your helping in turning Yorkshire and Humber Green in 2015.

1Candidate deposits have been required since the 1985 general election

2For donations over £50 we are legally obligated to take a record of the donor's name and address and to also confirm the donor is on the UK electoral register.

Promoted by Bluebell Eikonoklastes on behalf of the Yorkshire and the Humber Region Green Party Parliamentary election candidate list both at Flat B, 77 Grange Avenue, Chapeltown, LEEDS, LS7 4EN.

story:
Our Vision

We envision a world in which every student, regardless of circumstance, is empowered and confident to create their own future. For us at Camp Sudo, we've all felt that learning to code has been personally empowering and has changed our lives – we now want to share that feeling with the students who need it the most.

Why should we help these students?

There is an ever-growing divide between students that come from affluent schools and schools in inner city communities. With the belief that coding is the new literacy, computer science education is slowly but surely growing in these high schools. Yet, most of the current resources pooling into these schools benefit the students who are already privileged, while the underserved students, the ones who may need it most to finally close the gap or even surge forward, continue to be left behind.

These underserved students are the ones who consistently lack access to the enriching summer opportunities that are so critical to their educations. These are the students that we as Camp Sudo hope to teach to view the world through the lenses of computational thinking and problem solving that only coding can create. With programming, we want to close the gap for these students so that they can finally craft their own futures.

What is Camp Sudo?

Camp Sudo is a 5-week summer camp that will bring together 15 high school students and show them the benefits of coding. Camp Sudo will empower students to create their own projects, view computational and logical solutions through a problem solving perspective, and collaborate to solve tough problems. We will teach them a detailed curriculum that covers HTML, CSS and Javascript while also introducing them to the greater world of technology through company visits, guest speakers, and professional demos. 

Students will also enjoy many fun activities through out the camp such as bowling, beach days, laser tag, capture the flag, etc. Lastly, each student will be given a personal laptop which they will keep at the end of the summer to continue to foster their personal development.

Our camp is designed to foster technical capabilities, ownership of work, motivation for higher education, independence and self learning, and a control of their own futures.  We believe these five weeks can change their lives.


Our Progress And Timeline

Up until now:
  • The Students: The intervention teams at Berkeley High School and Berkeley Technology Academy are helping us identify our target students and to encourage them to apply online. We already have around 40 interested students.
  • Location: Classroom at the Berkeley Adult School in Berkeley, CA
  • Company Partnerships: Google will provide a company visit and guest speaker to our students. We also have a huge network of engineers in various tech companies
  • Curriculum: We've already created a first draft for the curriculum. Here's an example of one of the modules we're teaching: CSS Colors, HTML Divs/Spans
  • Finances: We are in the process of receiving a grant from the Berkeley Public Schools Fund
From now until the camp:
  • Finalize Students: We will select the fifteen students to attend our camp this summer
  • Finalize Curriculum: With help from volunteers and other mentors, we are planning to perfect the curriculum
  • Make Purchases: We will purchase all of the laptops, materials, transportation, and catered food 
  • First day: Camp Sudo begins on June 29th!!!!!! :D
The future:


Our Budget

We want this camp to be entirely free for the students. We are raising $10,000 dollars to go towards:
  • The costs of a space for the entire summer
  • Food
  • Laptops for each student
  • Activity materials
  • Transportation costs
  • Small stipend for the BUSD support staff
We will publicize our revenues and expenses on our website and constantly keep it updated. Check out updates on our budget in the "Updates" tab.

Your Impact

Your support will change the lives of these fifteen amazing students and potentially many more. We need to address the inequalities that will happen in the future preemptively, and we need to work together. Camp Sudo hopes to expand to multiple locations in the Bay Area in 2017, and nationally by 2020.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Reach out to us at campsudo@gmail.com and we'll brainstorm together
  • Check out our website (www.campsudo.org)
  • Forward this campaign to friends and family

About the team

We all hail from UC Berkeley. GO BEARS! Our team page is right here.

We have extensive experience in working within the social sector, especially through Blueprint (www.calblueprint.org). Some members have worked with Berkeley schools in the past, leading to the creation of the Friends And Family Grants Platform, an app which crowdfunds teacher projects. We were recently recognized for our efforts at the End of Year Spring Luncheon by the Berkeley Public Schools Fund!

We've worked on incredibly hard on Camp Sudo since February of 2015 and can't wait until June to teach these amazing students.

story:
My name is Harold Jorge and I have been an Emergency Medical Technician in New York City for the last three years and a Health and Safety Medical Technician for two years. I am also a Recruiting Officer at the last remaining Volunteer Ambulance Corp.(VAC); Throggsneck Volunteer Ambulance Corp, in the Bronx. Recruiting new and future EMTs, Dispatchers and Attendants and guiding them on their first steps as first responders.

 I have fallen in love with this rewarding and taxing career choice to the point that I wish to take my passion global. I want to broaden my expertise and further my reach on who I can aide in there momemnts of need no matter where they are,

Remote Medical International (RMI) is a company that offers training in the form of a course called "Remote Medicine Upgrade & Recertification (RMUR)" which can enable me in achieving my goals.

A Remote-EMT (R-EMT) is an EMT capable of rendering basic life support in urban, remote, and wilderness settings worldwide.

The course does not JUST award the certification of R-EMT. The course also certifies its participants with the Medical Care Person in Charge (MCPIC)cert. and Pre-Hospital Trauma Life Support (PHTLS)cert.

The MCPIC allows the certification holder to render medical care on-board ships at sea.

The PHTLS course improves the quality of trauma care and decreases trauma related injuries mortality rates through higher education for the first responders.

The training consists of a 10 day course which includes lodging by The North Cascades Institute and the classes are only offered in Lake Diablo, Washington. The following is a link to RMI webiste.

http://www.remotemedical.com/RMI-Training/Upgra...


I am unable to afford the tuition required for the training and the traveling expenses and find myself here with you seeking your help. I kindly ask you to assist me in achieving my goal and passion. Give me my wings.

The names of those who aide me will be tattooed in the shape of the Star of Life so I may always remember those who gave me the push I need.


Thank you.


(DISCLAIMER: Photo used for the campaign is from the RMI website)
story_txt: My name is Harold Jorge and I have been an Emergency Medical Technician in New York City for the last three years and a Health and Safety Medical Technician for two years. I am also a Recruiting Officer at the last remaining Volunteer Ambulance Corp.(VAC); Throggsneck Volunteer Ambulance Corp, in the Bronx. Recruiting new and future EMTs, Dispatchers and Attendants and guiding them on their first steps as first responders. I have fallen in love with this rewarding and taxing career choice to the point that I wish to take my passion global. I want to broaden my expertise and further my reach on who I can aide in there momemnts of need no matter where they are,Remote Medical International (RMI) is a company that offers training in the form of a course called "Remote Medicine Upgrade & Recertification (RMUR)" which can enable me in achieving my goals.A Remote-EMT (R-EMT) is an EMT capable of rendering basic life support in urban, remote, and wilderness settings worldwide.  The course does not JUST award the certification of R-EMT. The course also certifies its participants with the Medical Care Person in Charge (MCPIC)cert. and Pre-Hospital Trauma Life Support (PHTLS)cert.The MCPIC allows the certification holder to render medical care on-board ships at sea.The PHTLS course improves the quality of trauma care and decreases trauma related injuries mortality rates through higher education for the first responders.The training consists of a 10 day course which includes lodging by The North Cascades Institute and the classes are only offered in Lake Diablo, Washington. The following is a link to RMI webiste.http://www.remotemedical.com/RMI-Training/Upgra...I am unable to afford the tuition required for the training and the traveling expenses and find myself here with you seeking your help. I kindly ask you to assist me in achieving my goal and passion. Give me my wings.The names of those who aide me will be tattooed in the shape of the Star of Life so I may always remember those who gave me the push I need.Thank you.(DISCLAIMER: Photo used for the campaign is from the RMI website)

story:
Hi Everyone - 

This October, I hope to go on an exchange program to the city of Nice in the south of France with the rest of my 8th grade class. I will be staying for eleven nights at the home of a French student, who will stay at my house the following spring. While there I will attend school with my new French friend and go on some field trips in the area. As you know I’ve been going to a French school in New Orleans since kindergarten, but this exchange will be the first chance for me to compare my level in Math, Science, Social Studies, and especially in French with real French students. It’s a big deal for me and something my school does every year.

Of course, I will also visit the beautiful city of Nice and other interesting sites. I’ve never been to Nice, and I would love to explore this area of France. I guess I’m excited to visit this region, to attend a school in France, and to stay with a host family for the first time.  And all without my parents!

The total cost of this trip to France is $1,800. This amount comes from the airfare, the field trips, and insurance, mainly (the homestay is free). I'm trying to raise $1,300. Every year students at my school try to raise money to help pay for this trip. This year, my school thinks that instead of selling things (candy, etc.) to raise the money, students should look for sponsors who will make a donation in return for an awesome handwritten (by me!) postcard from Nice that they will receive in October.  The idea is to raise this money by the end of August. So if you can help, then just follow the instructions, don’t forget to include your mailing address (for a postcard), and thanks for being a sponsor!

Love,

Zoë

story:
The Moscow Manticores Quidditch Team is going to Northwest Regionals! But we need your help getting there! 

The Moscow Manticores have been working hard all year to get ready for Northwest Regionals on March 7th and now we're ready for it. Our only challenge is paying for it. Between hotels, gas, and food, this trip isn't going to be cheap and as poor college students, we're struggling to fund the trip. 

That's where you come in. We need all the help we can get, so we are offering perks and accepting donations. Your money would go towards funding our hotel (2 nights, 3 rooms at $104/night), the gas for our cars (3 cars for 600+ miles), and our other expenses (food, ice packs, water, etc.).

We're offering some pretty awesome perks like buttons, pictures, dates, and sexy calendars. So you scratch our backs and we'll scratch yours. We're also accepting donations if none of these perks interest you. 

Thank you in advance to all those who contribute! YOU GUYS ROCK!

story:
Women with disabilities in Laos are often unable to access an education and have very limited employment opportunities. The Lao Disabled Women’s Development Centre (LDWDC) tackles this by offering vocational training scholarships for disabled women and girls from poor backgrounds to study at the Centre. Students train in either sewing, weaving or handicraft production and after completing their training they are supported to find employment or start their own business.

The families of our disabled students cannot afford to pay tuition fees, so the students who are selected for the program are awarded scholarships that cover the costs of living and studying at the Centre.


Give a young disabled Lao woman a brighter future with a donation to the LDWDC Scholarship Fund

Donations to the LDWDC Scholarship Fund are pooled and distributed as needed to cover the costs of the vocational training program. Every cent donated is used to benefit our disabled students. 


Your donation can provide:

$17 - 1 month of training materials

This provides consumable items like cotton, fabric and glue as well as supplying each student with the necessary equipment for their chosen vocation. At the end of their training students can take this equipment home with them and use it to start their own small business, enabling them to generate an independent income.

$39 – Tuition fees for 1 month of vocational training

Students receive intensive training in either sewing, weaving or handicraft production as well as being able to choose to study electives including English, computing, and small business management. This training gives students the skills to earn an income, enabling them to support themselves and help their family.

$55 – 1 month of boarding fees for a student at the LDWDC

Our students come from remote villages all over Laos, but their families cannot afford to support them to live in the city to attend training. We provide them with accommodation in our dormitory, healthcare, food, drinking water, toiletries and pocket money. Living in the dormitory together means the students can study together and support each other while far away from home.

$70 – Start up funding to enable a graduate student to open her own small business

Upon graduation, each of our students receives a small amount of money to use to start their own small business. Students use this money to purchase fabric and sewing supplies to make the first products for their new business. They can then invest the profits from these products into new materials, kick-starting a cycle of income generation.

$110 - Full Scholarship for 1 month 

This will cover tuition fees and materials for intensive training in either sewing, weaving or handicraft production and electives such as English, computing and small business management as well as providing the student with accommodation, food, drinking water, toiletries, healthcare and a little bit of pocket money.

Thankyou !!!

story:
SAVOIA THE TAILOR 

 Master Tailor, Clothing, Costumes, Interior Designer, Taught Menswear At FIT

MICHELE SAVOIA DESIGN 2016 SCHOLARSHIP GOAL... $10,000

In 2015 we accomplished our mission and set-up The Michele Savoia Design Scholarship at Fashion Institute of Technology! We have a Current Use Scholarship for an In State Student  (Student is from NY, NJ, CT) Our first deserving scholarship award of $4,500 went to  Ron Ramos.  

FROM RON RAMOS

Dear Ms. Bibi and Scholarship Board, 

I want to thank you all for selecting me for this prestigious scholarship. Being the recipient, I will do everything in my ability to uphold the significance of Michele Savoia's legendary name as I take my steps to graduating and into my career. I aspire to develop my talents and to enhance my skills to master the art of designing to be as inspirational, talented, and successful as Michele Savoia. I look forward to meeting the everyone in the future and to personally thank all. 

Dear Ms. Bibi,

Thank you so much for believing in me and giving me this opportunity. The post you made on Facebook really made my night Ms. Bibi. I have so lucky to have come across paths with you because you have helped me through a tough beginning to a perfect end to my first semester abroad and continuing to give me support to the beginning of my career. I will never forget the kindness that you have bestowed on me and especially being the recipient to the great late designer Michele Savoia. Thank you so much for everything that has happened and for what will happen.

GOAL

It was our understanding that the monetary amount we raised would cover the year for our recipient, but only covered one semester. In the interim, tuition has gone up.

WE have decided to continue funding Ron Ramos for his final and last semester for $6,000 and the balance of $4000 will go to another deserving student in the fall of 2016! Because we reached our goal last year, The Savoia Scholarship Campaign is now InDEMAND: meaning this campaign stays open and we only pay 4% in fees!

To all of our past and future donors...THANK YOU FOR MAKING THIS HAPPEN!

PS: This year we are working on a T-Shirt Perk for donations of $100 and over!


OUR FIRST SAVOIA INDIEGOGO SCHOLARSHIP CAMPAIGN

In February 2014 our dear friend Michele Savoia passed away in a tragic accident on The Hudson River in New York City. Savoia was a MASTER TAILOR of MENSWEAR, and a graduate of Fashion Institute of Technology in NYC. 

We have decided to honor him and create  The Michele Savoia Design Scholarship at Fashion Institute of Technology. Savoia absolutely loved teaching at FIT and we would like to continue his legacy by having a deserving design student have the opportunity for an education in Savoia's name.

OUR GOAL: To raise a minimum of $3,000 with the GOAL of $50,0000 via social media and friends. Every DOLLAR raised (outside of Indiegogo fees) strictly goes to this Scholarship, whether we reach our goal or not. This means if we only raise $1,000, then someone can apply for that $1,000 in his name. 

This is a flexible funding campaign, meaning if you donate, there are no refunds if we don't reach our goal. What happens if we don't reach the minimum goal, is the difference  between 9% or 4% in fees.

Indiegogo Fees: We pay 9% and at the end of the campaign, IF WE REACH OUR GOAL, we ONLY PAY 4%. This is our incentive to reach the goal!


HOW THE SCHOLARSHIP FUND WILL WORK!

There are 2 types of Scholarships:
1. Current Use Scholarship: Where all the money is given away. The criteria will be defined as to who would receive the funds, by a committee  staff at FIT.  I requested it to be a design student, whose preference specialty is menswear. FIT currently does not have a separate menswear division, but does have courses. Savoia was in the first menswear class ever offered.

2. Endowment Fund: We would have to raise a minimum of $50,000 and the interest pays the tuition. This goes on in perpetuity, meaning 1 student every year will always receive funds. The more funds, the more scholarships.

Tuition is as follows:

If we raise $50,000 + will get Savoia a lifetime Scholarship in his name. 

THE PERK:  You will receive is the pleasure of knowing you sent a student to college to get an education. There is no better perk then that!


ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Michele Savoia and "The House of Savoia" achieved major accomplishments in his life including contributing to the costume design for Broadway Shows with Broadway designers 

Toni-Leslie James & William Ivey Long

CHITA  RIVERA

   “BROADWAY”  ENTIRE  CAST

MA  RAINEYS  BLACK  BOTTOM 

  “BROADWAY”  CHARLES  S.  DUTTON, WHOOPI  GOLDBERG  &  ENTIRE CAST 

 THUNDER  KNOCKING AT  YOUR  DOOR

  “BROADWAY”  ENTIRE  CAST

DESSA ROSE

“BROADWAY” ENTIRE CAST

THE PHIIDELPHIA STORY

   “HARTFORD STAGE”  ENTIRE CAST

SWING

  “BROADWAY”  ENTIRE  CAST

Savoia built suits (of Toni-Leslie James' design) for Tom Hanks in Lucky Guy, Scottsboro Boys both on Broadway and The West End, Finian's Rainbow (Broadway), Sam Waterston in the Longwharf's production of The Old Masters. He also built the menswear for Ricky Martin's for Evita on Broadway. 




Some of his clients included STEPHEN  BALDWIN, MATT  DILLON,VINNY  VELLA  SR., FRANKIE  ADONIS  “GOODFELLAS”  “RAGING BULL”, DOMINIC  CHIANESE  “SOPRANO’S”  UNCLE JR., DAN  LURIA , STAN  ANDERSON  “COURT  T.V.”, VICTOR  COLLICIO  “NEW  YORK  UNDERCOVER”  SLICK  RICK, CHRIS  NOTH  “SEX IN  THE  CITY”  MR. BIG, ROBERT  DENIRO  “ANALYZE  THIS”, TOM  HANKS  “ESQUIRE MAGAZINE”, GIANCARLO  GIANNINI  “NEW  YORK  STORIES”, MARC  ANTHONY  “VIDEO”, IGGY  POP, LENNY  KRAVITZ , RICKI  PAULL  GOLDIN  “2008 EMMYS”  JAKE  “DAYS OF OUR LIVES”, ROB THOMAS  “GRAMMYS”, KID  ROCK  “GRAMMYS”,  RON  WHITE  “RON  WHITE  SHOW”  SANDS,  LAS  VEGAS, COATI  MUNDI, KID  CREOLE  & THE  COCONUTS, ROYAL  CROWNE  REVUE, BIG  BAD  VOO – DOO  DADDY, MICHAEL ARENELLA  and his DREAMLAND ORCHESTRA


Now that we have our first student going to school, the Michele Savoia Scholarship will take on a life of its own and The Savoia Foundation can be built. My motto is "Build it and they will come"! You have to start somewhere and this is a great way to get going!

I AM PERSONALLY DREAMING TO HAVE SAVOIA SEND SOMEONE TO SCHOOL IN HIS NAME THIS YEAR!

"To me, 1937 was the epitome of life, the creativity in design, architecture and fashion. The world was cohesive. Everything was sexy, seductive, and streamlined; you knew where you were.” Michele Savoia

Thank You From Savoia's Family & Friends!

Brigitte Andrade

story:
Short Summary

My name is Robert Jason Jones, I'm a 4th year student preparing for graduation this year, or so I thought.  It was revealed to me that there had been mishandling of various documentation and that I no longer am eligible to extend my current student visa.  I am only 3 months away from graduating and may have to leave the country if i am unable to raise the appropriate funds which would delay my graduation.  I have been offered a teaching position but will not be able to accept the offer if I'm not able to get my current visa up to date as they will not be able to change the visa type on a expired visa.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds needed are $2,100 US dollars or roughly 100,000 Philippine Pesos.  The amount of 80,000 Pesos will be used to fund all the necessary documentation and visa fee's and penalties that have accrued, as well as update my status from student to working visa.  the remaining 20,000 will be for a 1 day flight from the Philippines to Hong Kong in order to fulfill one of the requirements for my new updated visa (which is to leave the country)

All donators will receive a special thank you on my website and i will keep you all updated on my teaching here in the Philippines via email.  For those that donate to any of the larger amounts check out our perks!

All funds above the the required amounts will be donated the Our Lady of Lourdes College Foundation College of Computer Science for use at their discretion.

The Impact

The impact is not just for me to  graduate, but you will be investing into the education of many future college students and allow me to share the knowledge I've been able to receive here in the Philippines.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is not raising the amount in time for the fund to arrive in a timely manner which is why this campaign is only set for 21-days.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If I have been a positive influence on you or someone you know please share this with your friends and family
  • Pray!  I believe in the power of prayer and if you are not able to support this financially please support this effort with your prayers.

If I have been a positive influence on you or someone you know please share this with your friends and family
Pray!  I believe in the power of prayer and if you are not able to support this financially please support this effort with your prayers.

story:
За 2016 година Пламенка Трајковска - гудачки квартет доби поддршка од Градот Скопје, за четири концерти ГУДАЧКИ КВАРТЕТ ВО НАШЕ МААЛО со делумно финансирање. 

Со цел да ги направиме поуспешни концертите и да  зголемиме бројот на концерти во Скопје се обраќаме до одделните општествено одговорни комании и личности  да ни помогнат за реализацијата на концертите. 

Ви благодариме !

Објаснување :

Пламенка Трајковска е академски музичар виолинист која долги години има за цел да ја доближи класичната музика до најшироката публика  и да ја доближи класичната музика до децата.

Причините заради кои децата ретко или никогаш не посетуваат концерти со класична музика се различни, но  имаме состојба каде голем број на деца од основните училишта никогаш или ретко посетуваат концерти со класична музика.

Затоа  Пламенка Трајковска создаде едукативна веб страна ,,Класика за деца” на која има пригодни содржини со класична музика за деца.

Пламенка реализираше концерт за деца ,,Музика и танц” во Културно информативниот центар, во О.У Ацо Шопов и реализираше ,,Концерт во наше маало” со помош на Град Скопје. 

English:

In 2016  Plamenka Trajkovska - string quartet  received the support of the City of Skopje for four concerts with partial funding.

In order to make the concerts more successful and increase the number of concerts in Skopje are appealing to individual socially responsible companies and individuals to help us in the realization of concerts.

Thank you !

About project:

Plamenka Trajkovska is an academic musician violinist who for many years aims to bring classical music to the widest audience and to bring classical music to children.

Reasons that children rarely or never attend concerts of classical music are different, but we have a situation where a number of children from primary schools never or rarely attend concerts of classical music.

Therefore Plamenka Trajkovska create an educational website for children ,, Classic music for children" where there is appropriate content for classical music for children.

Plamenka realized concert for children ,, Music and Dance "at the Cultural Information Centre, Primary School Aco Shopov and realized ,, Concert in our neighborhood" with the help of the City of Skopje.

story:
Are you ready to become a professional that is able to handle the demands of the modern world?

This Selenium WebDriver course is going to boost your professional value!

There are companies all over the world that are searching for talented developers that are able to create automated solutions for their business. With this level of demand, the need for more professionals that can handle this pressure is huge.


Our Selenium WebDriver with Java course is meant to be the most informative in the industry!

You will learn the following:

  • Best automation practices
  • How to create a production-ready framework in less than 60 min
  • Selenium WebDriver
  • Java Programming
  • Continuous Delivery
  • And so much more...

 

We are talking about a course that is going to be life-changing, and you will see how this affects the results you get when you apply for top positions in the industry. 

 

Nikolay Advolodkin gives elite level instructions in this course. He is a highly qualified and extremely successful engineer who has fine-tuned his skills as an Automation test & Quality assurance engineer. His recognitions include over 100,000 students taught in more than 100+ countries and he is known as a top Selenium instructor Worldwide.

 

2020 marks the beginning of the automation era!

 

We have already seen the power of automation and how beneficial it has been for all kinds of purposes. The coming decade is going to set a completely new standard that requires the development of automated solutions that provide further improvements in this process.


Those who are skilled in automation with WebDriver and Java knowledge are going to have a truly outstanding competitive edge. This can mean a whole new lifestyle for anyone who is looking to upgrade their job opportunities, increase their profit and supercharge their professional value.


The competition is fierce, but you can become the ultimate asset to any company!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The Goal

I'm looking to raise $4,000 to get this course going. These funds will cover the costs incurred to hire a world-class Java instructor as well as all the video editing costs. That way you get the greatest automation instruction in the best quality.

 

What You Get

As part of this once in a lifetime crowdfunding campaign, every person that contributes gets much more than just the course. You get a package of amazing products designed to guarantee your test automation success for life!

Every campaign backer gets:

1. Lifetime access to The Complete Selenium WebDriver with Java Bootcamp ($199 value)

Full access to the course, for life, with amazing support.

2. Two live webinar trainings with Q&A ($300 value)

Two extra webinars held at a future date where I will help you to reinforce some critical tech or skill and also will let you ask me live questions.

3. Best Resources To Master Selenium WebDriver Ebook ($49 value)

This ebook is one of my most prized possessions as it's been worked on since 2013 to have a list of the greatest resources that I use every day to help my test automation grow. It includes blogs, websites to practice test automation, courses, books and so much more

4. Best Automation Testing Patterns ebook ($49 value)

This ebook is another golden nugget for you to access whenever you need to know how to make a decision about some automation pattern. One customer said "This is a bible that everyone should read before doing test automation". You will learn ~15 patterns and anti-patterns that have been established in test automation for decades. And some new ones that are emerging such as not using Cucumber for test automation.

5. Quarterly webinar with industry expert (1 year of webinars)

Beyond the course, you will get a quarterly webinar to further enhance and grow your skills. I will team up with my top quality instructors to teach you amazing skills that you can't learn anywhere else. I know the leaders in mobile automation, web automation, visual testing, unit testing and so much more. You will get to learn from them in an intimate group setting.

6. Access to our secret FB Community of automation enthusiasts

This is an amazing opportunity to knowledge share with your fellow students. We all know that 2 brains are better than one to problem solve. How about 1,000 brains, or 10,000 brains? Imagine what we can do in test automation.

7. 24 hour SLA for course questions

You will get VIP level treatment and we will answer your course questions within 24 hours. That's an amazing benefit when you consider my courses get ~750 new students per month...

What's in the Complete Selenium Course?

The whole course will have many video instructions, here are just a few of the covered topics:

  • Learn how to develop a production-ready automation framework in under 60 min
  • Master world’s most common automation anti-patterns
  • Java focused on automation testers
  • Master Selenium WebDriver
  • Mastery of fundamental automation best practices
  • Knowledge of test parallelization
  • Cucumber
  • JUnit vs TestNG
  • Cross-browser automation
  • Correct synchronization strategies
  • Continuous Integration
  • Continuous Delivery
  • Selenium Grid
  • Understanding of world-class programming interviews
  • Master creation of great-looking HTML reports
  • Complete understanding of the simplest and most effective Page Object Pattern
  • Mastery of the most important Selenium WebDriver exercises

 

What's in each perk?

 

 

What previous students are saying

 

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“Excellent! Very thorough, well-organized, good pace… I particularly like the way the course has helped my knowledge build up gradually and systematically.”

Claud Towne

 

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“Everything is explained beautifully and clearly. The amount I paid is totally worth the course, hope to return something to the community after learning from this course.”

Tevin Gislason

 

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“This course is just amazing.”

Taryn Bruen

 

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“Quick enough to be engaged but steady enough to retain the information. I will certainly take advantage of the course until its end and recommend to friends!”

Jayne Zemlak

 

The Impact

 

 

Expected Delivery

 

The Complete Selenium WebDriver with Java Bootcamp will be released in May 2020. 

If the stretch goals are met, they will NOT impact the release of the course. Those can be appended to the course after the release. Each stretch goal will be released approximately 60 days after the release of the course.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

There are relatively few risks here. I will not be spending your money upfront, so in the very unlikely circumstances that I am unable to complete the course, I will refund everyone.

I also promise to refund anyone their pledge if they do not think the course is fully awesome.

I have created campaigns like this before and have been massively successful. Therefore, with your help, I will do it again.

Stretch Goals

Let's crush the goal and reach further. As we raise more money, that will unlock even more features of the course! The more money we can raise, the more amazing tutorials I can add to the course.

Every unlocked Stretch Goal will be released approximately 60 days after the course release.

Student Reviews

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot back this campaign, but want to help to create the greatest course ever, please share this campaign with your friends and family. Spread the message!

Let's create a future where test automation training makes everyone successful. A future where the training provides so much value that you are 100% comfortable at your work. In fact, you are a test automation rockstar. 

Please share this campaign.

story:
DRW Boxing

I am a teacher and boxing instructor to the brightest and most driven group of young men imaginable. I started the DRW Boxing Club because our students needed a safe place to be guided and challenged while being encouraged to release the aggression that builds in their challenging and sometimes traumatic daily lives. Through boxing, we emphasize the importance of self-control, confidence, and the  relentless hard work that precedes success.

Boxing is an incredibly difficult sport. It requires a team of dedicated individuals constantly working at their maximum potential. My students have accepted this challenge. However, there are circumstances that inhibit progress. A lack of boxing equipment is difficult enough to overcome, but many of my students lack the basic materials needed to stay healthy through a Chicago winter: hats, gloves, scarves, and coats.

The funds raised in this campaign will provide equipment for years to come. My goal with this fundraising drive is to raise enough money for students to be successful, competitive boxers as well as healthy, happy individuals.

Needs

Your contributions will go straight to purchases that bring us closer to our goals of building championship boxers and young men of integrity.

An general overview of expenses includes:

  • Heavy bags and stands
  • USA Boxing registration fees
  • Tournament entry fees, travel, and lodging
  • Competition apparel 
  • Winter coats, hats, and gloves
  • Miscellaneous corner materials (buckets, gauze, scissors, tape, water bottles, etc.)

To Thank You

To show appreciation for your contributions, and give a chance for everyone to have fun (except for me, at times), the first donation of each amount will result in the following postings:

$50 = Students completing a high intensity workout

$100 = Sparring match in our infamous "desk ring"

$200 = 2 students sparring against me

With your help, we can give our kids the resources that they deserve to pursue the sport that they love. As is true for me with my boxing experiences, I know that this is something that my guys will never forget and they will use what they learn in the gym to power them through their lives.

Thank you
